{"text": "\"Stormhill Mystery: Family Shadows\" Developer's Edition is a Adventure game. The game was developed and published by Specialbit Studio. Since this is a developer's edition, it comes with extra features that are not available in its' counterpart; the standard edition. Game Visuals I want to mention that the visuals in the game are nicely done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu. Game Audio I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well. Gameplay There are four different difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced; Hard and Expert. There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates that there are tasks that can be completed at certain locations. The interactive map is automatically given at the start of the game. There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary. It automatically comes stationary. There are composite items in the game. Some of these composite items may require extra components before they can be interacted with. All composite items are marked with a symbol in one of the corners. There are no hidden object scenes in the game. The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Most of the puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra feature section. There are morphing objects (beyond objects.) They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find. Since this is an editor's edition, there is a bonus chapter, but it can be accessed only after the main story is completed. There are ten different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked. Miscellaneous There are extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter and Wallpapers. Most of these features can be accessed only after the entire game is fully completed. There are six different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its Booster Pack Creator. Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.", "appid": "968820", "steamid": "profiles/76561198027424772", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1602417600.0}

{"text": "Tidal Tribe is a god game by a single developer, in which you have to shape beach terrain to protect your small civilization and to cultivate a manifold vegetation. The game includes a story mode with side quests, a free mode to play around and a challenge mode. Graphics and soundtrack provide a relaxing experience, the art is adorable (look at those ducks in the trailer!) the NPCs are vivid and provide feedback. There are many different requirements for letting plants grow and you're even able to assist your civilization by collecting fruits for them. While the map provides many filters and the built-in wiki shows all information you need to know, there aren't many direct status messages after the tutorial, which can make you feel a bit lost.  Given the details and the amount of content, the release price seems justified to me. {"text": "Аркада , платформер и стелс от Klei Entertainment   Кому рекомендую игру- всем,  кто любит качественные игры; всем,кому нравится ниндзя , и  кто хочет посмотреть на них  в более менее правдободобных тонах; всем любителям платформеров и стелс-боевиков.  Игра , почти идеальна геймплейно. Все, что в ней есть работает как надо, а лишнего нет вообще. В первую очередь- сам ниндзя.Образ главного героя,действительно, приближен к реальному.Он, не сможет перезать всех с одного взмаха , а смерть придет от пары пуль в бою.Наш герой прячется в темных углах, и наносит сокрушительные удары из подтишка, а в арсенале у него куча гаджетов, которые существовали реально.За всю игру, можно даже не убить никого(ну почти никого) , а можно перерезать всех и каждого(ну естественно скрытно, а не на право и лево) . Хотя, сама игра, поощряет играть без жертв.С гаджетами, можно смело эксперементировать , игра только \"За\". В игре простое и интуитивное управление.Звук и саундтрек вписаны, как одно целое.Визуально, игра просто великолепна, её визуальный ряд вообще ни с чем не перепутаешь.В игре нету ничего сложного, но и совсем простого не найдешь, идеальный баланс.Сюжет очень прост, и даже клиширован, но со своей изюминкой(точнее мистикой), а под конец , просто достигает своего пика, причем делает он это на пару\" с визуальным рядом и выключенным геймплеем\". Конечно, есть в игре и не дочеты, точнее один,это то самое простое управление, которое просто не всегда делает \"как ты заплонировал\"( за всю игру лишь пару раз по-настоящему нервировало).Некоторые, еще жалуются на не достаточную сложность , ну тут ,пожалуй, обосновано.   Н͇О͇ ͇К͇О͇М͇У͇ ͇Ж͇Е͇,͇ ͇И͇Г͇Р͇А͇ ͇Н͇Е͇ ͇П͇О͇Н͇Р͇А͇В͇И͇Т͇С͇Я͇ ͇?͇ Есть момент, из которого вы можоте её бросить. Сам геймплей , который так вылезан до идеала, может просто приесться. Игра очень медленно набирает обороты( при том, что сама она часов на 8 тянет).Тут появляються, новые гаджеты,враги,окружение, прокачка героя и новые приемы, но все работает под гейплей, который раскрывает себя, уже в первые два часа , а если вас он(геймплей) не зацепил(по неизвестным мне причинам) игра кажется скучной и однообразной. {"text": "As it turns out, we are dealing with an interesting story. Fortunately,  the story is well told. There is the good characterization in the game. The dialogues and monologues heard during the game confirm this statement. The conversations of the main character of the game and his companions are interesting in their way. The relationship of the team members is also expressed in the form of these dialogues and the interaction between them makes the game process more attractive. Another feature of this section is the existence of humorous dialogues along with shocking scenes. In other words, the game has the capacity to both laugh and regret. The bottom line is that the game can bring these two opposing modes together. Combining such a story with a good characterization makes the game brilliant and more interesting. The only drawback to the game's dialogues is the poor translation of a series of words early in the game. The gameplay fluctuates but is generally satisfactory. On the other hand, battles are of medium quality. The battles may be appealing at first, but after a while, the game takes on a repetitive trend and almost a constant formula is repeated over and over again; So much of the game is about engaging with multiple enemy Waves that surround you every few minutes. On the other hand, with capabilities such as Stun Commands, conflicts become relatively diverse. With the Heal Commands feature, you can also order one of your healthy teammates to get your injured teammate back to normal. According to similar games, they cannot revive you. Covering is one of the features of the game and plays an essential role in the quality of the fights. It can be said that the game has been able to take advantage of all the necessary standards and create a flawless system. If you are close to a trench while running, you will slip a few meters into the trench and take refuge sooner. On the other hand, the good artificial intelligence of the main character causes him to change his position when he changes height. For example, if the trench is a car, it sits in front of the car and follows the path of the cabin. Graphics may be one of the most important sections of the gaming community. One of the parts of the game that is hard to say anything about it for sure is the game's graphics. The game is very eye-catching at first glance. the first thing that catches your eye is the good lighting and the quality of the game's shadows. Graphic effects such as blasting, bullet hitting obstacles, improve this quality. The game is also at a good level in terms of artistic graphics, and the environments are designed to be creative in some cases. But the problems of this section can be seen when you pay more attention to details. These problems are more noticeable when some graphic effects such as sweating are tied to these details. It is ridiculous to imagine a face with low detail and sweat. View Distance is not very high and the developers have tried to cover it using graphic techniques. The game's loading pages are also creatively designed and are a combination of still images and dynamic images. Each stage has its dedicated page. sands also play an effective role in the game's atmosphere. On the other hand, merging the sandstorm with some of the events that take place during the game puts the game's atmosphere in excellent condition. The game also has good cinematic scenes. Vulnerability is also present in some components of the work environment, and a certain number of them are destroyable to a limited extent. The animations intended for the main character and his team are of good quality, but the enemies do not have interesting animations. For example, when shooting them they don't show an interesting reaction. Weapons also have a good variety. Every weapon has a realistic reloading animation. One of the major problems with the game is that it doesn't pay enough attention to artificial intelligence. Although your allies have relatively good artificial intelligence, the developers seem to have paid little attention to the enemies. Enemies, for example, sometimes fire without a purpose. Or, for example, they show strange reactions when they see a grenade. {"text": "本来买回来是为了支持一下开发组， 既然有时间，就把它玩通了。游戏目前没有中文，但是用到的英文并不复杂，部分生僻词并不影响对故事的理解，我看得比较慢，大概两个小时通关。对于一个首发价格19的游戏，可以说做得相当精致了。(不愧是ALICE IN DISSONANCE) 推荐购买人群：Fault系列粉丝、成人童话爱好者 现实世界是残酷的，在那里，有些孩子在条件恶劣的孤儿院里，在被变成动物卖掉的恐惧中惶惶不可终日；有些孩子被母亲逼迫学习，在巨大的压力和孤独中人格分裂；有些孩子虽然很努力，但因为天生的不健全而被父母抛(mou)弃(sha)；还有些孩子沦落为童工，梦想与尊严被无情地践踏。 奇幻世界是美好的，在那里，你可以完全不用考虑温饱的问题，饮食纯粹是娱乐；你可以做你想做的一切，没有人对你指手画脚；你想要什么东西，只要闭眼祈祷就能得到。 但是，那些遭受苦难的孩子们，在奇幻世界里并没有得到真正的救赎。他们在完全无忧无虑、无拘无束的世界中，逐渐感到空虚、迷茫，最终失去自我，陷入一种盲目的状态中。Mhaka发现了这个问题，当我不再是我，你也不再是你的时候，永远在一起的承诺又有何意义？ 所以，无论小仙子如何吓唬她、挽留她，Mhaka最终还是选择离开、选择面对、选择成长。最终她和他在残酷的现实世界中也找到了自己的一席之地，过上了真正幸福美满的生活。 虽然画风清新，故事也算正能量，不过我还是认为不是给小孩子看的童话，我好不容易调动自己的童心，进入看童话的状态，对残酷现实的描写，偶尔略显诡异的氛围，以及突如其来的猎奇让我有点措手不及，不禁感叹看这种童话长大的卢森海德小朋友们心理承受能力之强大。", "appid": "753220", "steamid": "profiles/76561198255187247", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "13", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1519387200.0}

{"text": "Jogo divertidissimo e muito barato,fui surpreendido pela simplicidade,dificuldade e nivel de prendimento desse jogo.Vale cada centavo!!!", "appid": "221640", "steamid": "profiles/76561198313371556", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1546171200.0}
{"text": "Looking at the reviews so far I'm apparently one of the few who knew what he was getting into. I think the storepage and the trailers communicated well enough what type of game this was gonna be.  I would say, as a FIRST IMPRESSION, after DiRT 2 this is my favorite game of the five. It has that 'playful' character of DiRT 2 and a bit of that Forza Horizon vibe, at least for me. Wether that's a good thing or not you have to decide for yourself. For me it's exactly what I'm looking for in such a racing game. If I want realism and get serious I jump into my car and drive to work. So DiRT 5 is a pure arcade racer now. Even the typical rally stages with a co-driver are replaced with a lot of other but fun modes. They also ditched the \"Simulation\" mode option from DiRT 4. I don't mind that because we have choice nowadays in what we want to buy and play. If this isn't your cup of tea don't spit in it and get your own flavor.          Some things I like The stylish and colorful presentation works great with the theme of this game. They also put a lot of effort in the soundtrack. You can feel the passion Codemasters has for the franchise. Like I mentioned, It's not  a rallygame anymore but more a 'party' game with those same cars.  Graphics are absolutely effing gorgeous if you have the horsepower to dial it all up. With an i5 8500, 16 GB RAM and a 1070Ti, I get an average of 46 fps on 1440p with high settings, wich is reasonable but not great. And than you have Very high wich I'm not even gonna try. However, there's a feature to let the game take care of your settings automatically wich works surprisingly well. Now the average fps is around 70 fps without a noticeable difference in graphical fidelity. All in all it's way more taxing than I expected. A lot more than GRID (2019) for comparison. The new dynamic weather and daytime feature where weather conditions can change during a race is just awesome.  A lot of variety in tracks and landscapes and most important, cars and race types including the newly added sprint cars. And finally there's a photomode. It's a bit clunky in that it takes some time to move the filter sliders around (it would be nice if it could be controlled with the mouse) and the processing of the image is a bit slow. I hope they add support for NVIDIA Ansel wich I still prefer but it's still a welcome addition.  Things I like less The sound is pretty good actually but could be better. I'm missing a bit of grunt in the lower end of the engine sounds. Many cars just don't sound as mean and agressive as they should. It's just a bit underwhelming.  The post race replay feature or in better words: the lack thereof. Where the hell is the replay option Codemasters? They finally included a photomode to accompany their pretty graphics engine and than removed the replay feature, wich was part of their games for as long as I can remember. I love watching replays with various camera angles after an exciting race and taking screenshots. Now you have to take screens during the race wich breaks the immersion a bit for me.      Although this isn't a sim by any means, DiRT always used to have some basic tuning options too adjust your gear ratios, suspension, break balance and such. That's ditched too. You still have your options for ABS, TC and SC in 3 levels in de game options btw. No wheel support... yet. This is just silly. CM should know there will be backlash about this. They say it's coming but it should be in the game during launch.  At the moment there are some stability issues too. Many people are reporting random crashes. I had a few CTD's too but it looks a driver update from NVIDIA fixed it or it could be the day one patch CM released today. Anyway the game seems to use less VRAM now.  All in all, again, as a first impression I think this is a worthy new next gen entry in the franchise even with the strange choice to remove some basic and obvious features. {"text": "Do i have to write something here about this?I think not", "appid": "374320", "steamid": "profiles/76561198040846861", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "1", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1596196800.0}
{"text": "GOKEN follows the story of Edge - The master of the 5 blades. Edge has spent the last 5,000 years sealed away at the top of Swords Peak by the god O-Zone after an unsuccessful challenge on his life. Woken up one day by a small child, Edge must travel the world in search of his lost blades. Only then can he finally have his revenge on the gods! GOKEN is an Action-JRPG, not dissimilar to classic JRPG's such as The Secret of Mana, A Link to the Past and Alundra.  The first hour or so of GOKEN is a real slog, you only have access to one weapon so combat consists of spamming your choice of X or Y, you lack any real stamina, so you won't be going anywhere fast and the omission of a mini map means you may feel a little disorientated at first. Don't let the slow start put you off, before long you will be reunited with your second weapon. A giant great sword, at this point the game starts to pick-up and its unique combat system really starts to shine. You can have any two of your potential 5 weapons equipped at any one time. By tapping either attack button you can perform a 3-hit combo, at the point of the 3rd hit you have a chance to generate a special move. The special move generated will depend on what weapon you have equipped. Enemies are strong and varied in GOKEN, there's at least 20 - 30 different enemy types and maybe 5 or more variations of each type. Each enemy has their own attack pattern and weapon weakness, you'll need to learn these if you don't want frequent visits to the Game Over screen.  The game will automatically save your progress at points, but this is far too infrequent for my liking. Luckily you're able to save your progress at any time from the pause menu. The progression system in GOKEN is separated into two parts, character upgrades and weapon upgrades.  The character upgrade system is really quite cool. When you level up, you are rewarded with ink points, collect enough of these points and you can take them to your local tattoo parlour and apply them to your character. Applying tattoos will reward you with standard stat increases on top of what you receive for levelling up.  You can also unlock empty slots, in these empty slots you are able to place special ink which you will find during your travels. These special ink's are much more powerful than the standard upgrades. They're able to infuse the protagonist with special offensive and defensive powers, they can even increase the amount of gold or experience acquired, The weapon upgrade system is more standard fare and pretty typical of most RPG's. On occasions, defeated enemies will drop crafting items, you can take these items to blacksmiths located in each town. Assuming you have acquired enough weapon experience, you can use these items to improve each weapon and make it even stronger. Don't expect a massive array of graphical options in GOKEN, after booting up the game and navigating to the options menu I was greeted by 2 very lonely options. Resolution and window type. There's actually no graphical fidelity options of any kind and at this point the game doesn't support native borderless window mode either. With that being said, I was able to Alt & Tab back to the desktop on multiple occasions and the game didn't crash once. To my surprise, the graphics in GOKEN are beautiful. Bright, colourful, detailed, there isn't even a hint of aliasing. The world is separated into large and very distinct areas, each one brimming with secrets to discover. And being an open world game, you're free to travel to each area at your leisure. At first I had a few performance issues with GOKEN, nothing major, but there was some very obvious frame skipping during screen transitions. After some investigating, it was clear that my GPU was dropping down to idle clocks during gameplay. I switched my GPU to max performance mode and that seemed to do the trick, from then on it was smooth sailing. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about the audio. Sound effects are synced well with actions and the music is high quality. There's plenty of varied audio tracks and it always felt appropriate to what was happening on-screen at the time. My time with GOKEN was spent exclusively using an Xbox One controller. Controller support works well straight out of the box and the game features two separate Controller schemes.  GOKEN is a great throwback to classic JRPG's of yesteryear. The story is interesting and for the most part very well written. Combat is tight and has a nice layer of strategy.  The game is large but not massive, my first playthrough clocked in at just over 15 hours, this was literally an A - B playthrough, there's plenty more for me to see and do in GOKEN. After beating the final boss you also have the opportunity to load your completed save and carry on. I haven't had the opportunity to play this content yet, but I'd be very surprised if GOKEN didn't have more secrets to uncover. I thoroughly enjoyed my time with GOKEN and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to any fan of the genre. Considering the game is still in early access, I think it's a massive achievement and can't wait to see where the development team take it.", "appid": "671260", "steamid": "profiles/76561198012794916", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "43", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1501416000.0}

{"text": "It's rather short, as in my 32 hours, I am one, waiting-based achievement away from 100%, all achievements (on Origin, as there are none on Steam), all planets and such 100% explored and all secrets found. While fairly pricey for, from what I've heard, an average of 40 hours for full completion, I would understand if you didn't want to buy it at full price, but it's 100% worth getting if you can catch it on sale. The easiest comparison is Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice, though the combat is a tad less smooth, honestly I'm still not quite sure about the parry timing most of the time, but it's very quite fun. If you're a fan of games such as Sekiro, you'd enjoy it, though it is far easier than that, as a veteran to the Soulsborne series, I only died a significant amount of times to one specific boss (The boss of Dathomir, probably ending the 2nd third of the game if i remember correctly, maybe later). If you're a star wars fan, you'll also enjoy it, as there is a lot of (officially Canon, since every game EA publishes is considered \"official Disney canon\" (Up to you what to believe anyway)) lore to read, and some familiar faces and places. Of course, the game is harder than most games, so be prepared for some challenge, though it is easier than other games of its kind (even on Grandmaster!) All in all, as with every game developed by Respawn, it's good. Little bit overpriced for playtime, but not for enjoyment. Have fun if you buy it, or wait for a sale, but it's worth getting somewhere down the line. Update: As of the new Update, nothing has been improved. Apparently some bugs have been fixed, but the combat wasn't made smoother and I haven't had any issues with the bugs said to be fixed anyway. And in terms of the main 3 additions, I'm generally unimpressed: 'New Journey +' - This is NOT a New Game + mode as in the same sense as any other game. You retain all unlocked cosmetics, but you do not retain any of your unlocked skills, nor is the difficulty increased. So basically, it's just an excuse to increase the longevity of the game by letting you play it again and unlocking some Inquisitor Kestis cosmetics while you do so. Not what I'd like it to be.  'Combat Challenges' - They're alright, but I'm not a fan, because most of them end up with, at one point or another, the game throwing a lot of enemies at you at once, and at least on Grandmaster difficulty, that just means a lot of unblockables being spammed at you, which is frustrating and not enjoyable, and definitely isn't worth getting 4 more skins for BD-1 to 100% all of them. While not the best at the combat, I'd consider myself pretty good at it, as I didn't struggle too bad in the main game, besides some of the harder bosses, but I can't even complete most of the challenges, nevermind perfect them without taking damage! 'Battle Grid' - This is the part I don't have an issue with. Though, I'm rather apathetic about it anyway. You can make custom fights. I mean, it's cool to have, but it's not exactly going to fulfil anyone's dreams, especially when watching AI fight in this game is rather janky. All in all, a rather disappointing update, but it doesn't at all detract from the main game.", "appid": "1172380", "steamid": "profiles/76561198084375149", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "20", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1587988800.0}

{"text": "+rep", "appid": "730", "steamid": "profiles/76561198208684924", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1600344000.0}
{"text": ": Developed and published by  ,   saw its way on Steam early this year. It managed to get some attention from horror fans, and so far maintains an overall Mixed score. I always have a hard time checking Indie Horror games, simply by the fact that many of them are generic and rushed.  however, is neither. It’s not the latest sensation, of course, in fact, it’s quite far from it, but it’s interesting, well made, and not falling into mediocre concepts overly seen already. On the same level as its horror orientation, players are motivated to explore, always with a crippling fear behind the ear, and I really like that. Visuals and atmosphere combined to create a presence, one that haunts you. We take the role of a man who finds himself in an abandoned building. Not many clues are given to why he is there, nor who is responsible for dragging him there. We do know that, we must leave, before it’s too late. Several notes are left throughout the game, and finding them can lead us to some answers, but as expected, clues won’t be as clear as you might think. It’s actually a cool mix of puzzles and “Escape Room“ scenario, in a horror setting. Most gameplay involves traversing rooms and figuring out the next door to open, to gather yet another key. The whole planning of it may sound somehow repetitive, but it plays well with its simple mechanics. When it comes to the horror part of the gameplay, our protagonist is never in any real danger, as there isn’t anyone chasing him, except through his memories and flashbacks. If you love horror oriented locations and adventures,   will definitely be pleasurable to you, allowing a peaceful exploration with no need to rush. Visually, the scenarios are somehow repetitive, but well depicted and considerably detailed. I personally enjoy the detail of the floor being clustered with garbage like cigarette butts and roaches. Some locations like bathrooms are quite interesting, and the occasional blood trails add a nice touch. The corridors and overall lighting add a good visual atmosphere, with lamps flickering and reflects playing games with the shadows. There’s absolutely a dedicated passion put into the game, and it’s easy to ignore all the issues when the overall quality is above what you’d expect. Ambient and soundtrack are both well combined, with a minimalist Tracklist created by  , who’s known for creating horror themed soundtracks, and I must say, it suits the game really well. It doesn’t sound pretentious and creates the necessary vibe to be enjoyed. Special sound effects are also on the same quality line, with a good production. All in all,   ended up surprising me, even though its length goes around up to one hour on the first playthrough, it can quickly be completed once you memorize the layout. It’s especially good if you purchase on sale, and take the opportunity to play it during that extra hour or so you have to burn.", "appid": "1187420", "steamid": "profiles/76561198158196956", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "11", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1603108800.0}

{"text": "wulfriccc ;)) Gerçekten korkmak isteyenlere... Kariyerimizde yükselmek isteyen hırslı azimli ve genç bir gazeteciyiz. Hayatımızın haberini yapmak istiyoruz. Derken bir mail gelir ve bir akıl hastanesinde akıl almaz olaylar olduğunu bunu açığa çıkarmam gerektiğini, burada olanları herkese iletmem gerektiğini söyler. İşte aradığımız fırsat deriz ve hemen yola çıkarız. İlgili hastane daha önce kapatılmış hayır amaçlı tekrar açılmış durumda. Mekan göründüğünde radyomuzda hafif cızırtılar hissetmeye başlarız. Hatta kapının önüne geldiğimizde iletişim tamamen kopar. O kadar iyimseriz ki sadece bir sinyal bozucu ile iletişimin koparıldığını düşünürüz. Bir şekilde hastaneye girmenin yolunu buluruz. Elimizde kayıt için getirdiğimiz kameramız var. Ve acı gerçekle karşılaşmamızla oyunumuz başlar... Oyunda tamamen korku teması üzerine kurgulanmış. Bir resident evil veya silent hill deki gibi elinizdeki silaha güvenmek gibi bir seçeneğiniz yok. Hayatta kalabilmek adına tehlikenin göründüğünü noktalarda kaçıp saklanmanız ve sizi kovalayanın geri dönmesi için dua etmeniz gerekiyor. Aydınlıkta sorun yok fakat karanlıkta elimizdeki kameranın gece görüşü ile ilerlememiz gerekiyor. Gece görüşüde pil harcıyor. Oyundaki düzenli tek ihtiyacımız zaten pil. Oyun müzikleri sizi inanılmaz geriyor. Geçtiğiniz koridorda sizi korkutacak hiç bir şey olmasa bile müzik tek başına yetebiliyor. Ayrıca tımarhanedeki aklını tam kaybetmemiş olan yarı semptom sahibi hastaların haykırışlarıda cabası. Oyuncunun duvar kenarına tutunarak başını eğip koridora bakışı, saklandığınız yerden çevreyi izleyişiniz, korktuğunda sesinin soluğunun başka yerlerinden çıkması, ağzından burnundan akan salyaları çekme sesi. {"text": "This is my favorite Zachtronics game so far. It's beautiful to watch, and incredibly fun to solve the puzzles. The difficulty is definitely lower than games like Spacechem because you are not limited by space or number of waldos. However, I think that makes the game great because you have the freedom to solve puzzles less efficently and go back later. Sigmar's Garden is also quite fun. I was a little confused at first but now it's a very relaxing game that requires a little less thought than the actual puzzles. My only concern is the quantity of puzzles. The story felt a little short, probably because of the lower difficulty. Luckily, there's still high scores to beat and custom puzzles to solve. I'm hoping there are more achievements added, specifically \"challenge\" modes of levels, like how Spacechem/TIS had achieves for beating levels in a certain way. {"text": "Bazı insanlar takıntılıdır, bir kitap seri halinde çıkarıldıysa ilk çıkandan son çıkana kadar onları okumaya başlar ve araya kesinlikle başka bir şey eklemez. Bir oyundan beş tane çıktıysa ilk oyundan sonuncusuna gelinceye dek araya başka bir oyunun kaynak yapmasına izin vermez ve o seriyi bitirir. Anlaşılan bu takıntılı insanlar grubunun içlerinde bulunanlardan bir tanesi de ben oluyorum. Neden mi? Assassin's Creed ile başlayan bu uzun yolculuk Origins bitene kadar devam etti ve daha da sürecek gibi görünüyor. Assassin's Creed Origins bizi firavunların son dönemine sürüklerken yaşanılan güç savaşı ve taht kavgaları da tüm çıplaklığı ile gözler önüne seriliyor. Eski krallıkta firavun tarafından atanan Medjay rütbesine sahip bir karakter olan Bayek bize oyun boyunca eşlik ediyor. Medjaylar iyi bir eğitim görmüş, savaşmak konusunda ehil kişilerdir. Amaçları; Firavunun kendisini ve çıkarlarını korumak olduğu gibi Mısır topraklarını himaye etmek ve halkını gözetmektir. Kukla olarak yönetilen toy bir firavun tahtın başına geçirilmiştir ve ardındaki danışma meclisi de gücü ele geçirmeye çalışan yamyamlar gibidir. Antik bir çağdan kalan cihaz ellerindedir ve nasıl kullanacaklarını bilemezler. Oklar bir anda Siva vahasında bulunan son Medjay'a çevrilir ve kahramanımız için tersliklerin başlangıcı böylece vuku bulur. Hangi terslikler dediğinizi duyar gibi oluyorum. Bayek'in neden intikam almak istediğini öğrenmek istiyorsan, her şeyi devletten beklememeyi de öğrenmen gerekiyor. Zaman, oyuna start verme zamanındır. M.Ö Mısır dönemi. Şu anki ile karıştırmayın çünkü arada uçurumlar var. Bilim, sanat ve mimaride inanılmaz derece popüler olan bir yerden bahsediyorum. Koca bir Mısır'dan... Gez gez bitmiyor, ister deve ile keşif yap istersen at sırtında dört nala vur. Tercih senin ama hikayeye gömülüp koca haritayı keşfetmeden oyunu bitirme. Bazen öyle şeyler ile karşılaşacaksın ki bunlar sana ne dönüyor lan burada dedirtecek. Bir anda ortaya çıkan adamların sana bir yer göstermesinden tut, uçan bir şalın seni bir yerlere sürüklemesine kadar hatta çölün orta yerinde küçük bir saksıda bulunan bir çiçeğe kadar pek çok acayiplikler mevcut. Büyük bir merak duygusunun içerisine itelendiğini kendin de göreceksin. Düşünsene yüzüklerin efendisine bile gönderme yapmışlar oyunda... Artık harita üzerinde görevlerin seviyeleri var ve bu seviyelere eriştiğin zaman rahatlıkla yapabiliyorsun. Yoksa Counter oynamaya yeni başlayan bir adam gibi ekip arkadaşlarının yanında çıplak hissediyorsun ve düşmanın tek bir darbeyle seni tahtalıköy semalarına postalayabiliyor. Davul bile dengi dengine derler, kendi denginde tüy siklet birini bulduğunda Senu adını verdiğin kartalın ile hedeflerini mimleyip buna göre bir politika belirleyebiliyorsun. Önceki oyunlarda olduğu gibi cinayetler bulunuyor ve ipuçları sayesinde kimin yaptığını çözmeye çalışıyoruz. Tabi bu kez adaletin kılıcı sen olduğundan cezasını kendin kesebiliyorsun. İmdat polis diye bağırmana ihtiyaç kalmıyor. Assassin's Creed Origins vuruş hissi ile her ne kadar ön plana çıksa da kombat sisteminden ötürü sınıfta kalmayı başarıyor. Ben şu oyunda adam gibi ardı ardına kombo yapamayacak mıyım yahu dedirtiyor. Hala 2. oyunun dövüş sistemini özlüyorum. Az önce koca bir Mısır'ın varlığından bahsettik. İçerisindeki papirus gizemleri ve bu gizemlere ışık tutmak, ayrıca bulmaca çözmek hatta filler ile kapışmak oyuna ayrı bir hava katmış kabul ediyorum. Belki uslu bir çocuk olursan gladyatör bile olabilir, kendini Spartacus gibi hissedebilirsin. İstersen ganyan oynayacağın yerde bir at arabası al ve hemen yarışlara katıl. Şöhretin basamaklarını adım adım çıkarken insanların gönlünde taht kur. Görev çeşitliliği ne kadar fazla olsa da harita çok büyük olunca sıkılmaya başlayabiliyorsun. Yine de durmak yok görevleri bitirmeye devam. Yoksa kim yüzlerce sığınağa sızıp kaynakları yağmalayacak, kim hayvan inlerindeki hayvan reisi öldürecek? Sen yapmazsan ben yapmazsam nasıl çıkar karanlıklar aydınlığa? Arada Aya denilen kadın karakteri oynamamız ve onla beraber görev tamamlıyor olmamız oyunu daha zevkli hale getirmiş. Sürekli aynı karakter değil de farklı bir karaktere de dokunuyor olmamız bir farklılık meydana getiriyor ve oyuncuyu sıkmıyor. Onlarca ok atışı gemine yapılana kadar bekle derim, bakalım gemideki askerleri gaza getiren davulcu seni de yeteri kadar havaya sokabilmiş mi?  Assassin's Creed Origins, fotoğraf modu ile de dikkatleri üzerine çekiyor. Mısır'ın tüm güzelliklerini çekebilir, instagramda yayınlayabilirsin. Yalnız milleti usandırmadan at, görmemiş bir seyahate çıkmış, çekmiş bir tarafını koparmış demesinler. Benden sana dost tavsiyesi. {"text": "Bu incelemeyi okurken oyunun her özelliğini 10/10 alın olumsuz bahsettiğim yerlerde kırın. Ben Infinite' i bir çok kez bitirdim ve en favori ikinci oyunum. Bu oyunu da 2 yıl kadar önce olsa gerek ilk oynamaya kalktığımda oyunun başlarında bırakmıştım. Çünkü atmosferi acayip boğucu gelmişti. Cıvıl cıvıl mekanlarda göklerdeki bir yerden okyanusun karanlık diplerine, yer yer gerilim ögeleri barındıran bir yere girmem doğal olarak böyle hissettirdi. Oyunun atmosferi oldukça karanlık. En sevimli mekanlar bile biraz ürkütücü. Ama ilerledikçe bu karanlığa alışılıyor belkide bir parçası olduğumuzdandır. Ama genel anlamda gayet güzel atmosfer. Oyunun geçtiği yılları hissettiriyor. Oynanış Infinite' e oranla azıcık daha yavaş. Mesela plazmid kullanmak için silahı kaldırmanız gerekiyor. Silahlar yeterli sayıda ama modellerini ve fiziklerini pek sevmedim, daha iyi olabilirlerdi. Ve bir tür hata var. Yere çömmüş bir şekilde sağa sola yürürken nişan aldığınızda yamuk nişan alıyor hedefi göremiyorsunuz. Infinite' deki gibi, oynadıkça düşmanlara karşı strateji geliştirip çok daha kısa sürelerde işlerini bitirebiliyorsunuz. Oyunun başında Big Daddy' ler ile ölüp dirilip, ölüp dirilip dakikalarca cebelleşirken, oyunun sonuna doğru 20 saniye bazen de bir kaç saniye sürüyordu. (Tuzak okları oldukça güçlü.) Oynanışı ara sıra değiştiriyor oyun. Örneğin buzlu bir ortama giriyorsunuz eritmeniz gerekiyor her yeri yada sadece ingiliz anahtarı ile bırakıyor sizi, plazmidleri alıp rastgele bir tane veriyor gibi gibi. Oyunun en beğenmediğim noktası harita büyüklükleri. Oyunun başında ''Bu oyunun haritaları Infinite' e oranla geniş, ne güzel'' derken, oyunun sonlarına doğru yorulmaya başladım haritanın her köşesini aramaktan. Başka bir oyun olsa benim yeterli cephanem var ben devam ediyorum diyebilirsiniz ama ses kayıtları hikaye anlatımında çok önemli. Misal en çok gereksiz harita bölgesi Apollo Meydanı bölümündeki Fontaine Fakirhaneleri idi. Bir tane silah geliştirmesi için o kadar yer koymaya değer mi? Bir de haritaların gereksiz büyük olması yetmezmiş gibi bize çeşitli özellikler kazandıran genleri bile değiştirmek için haritadaki bir otomata gitmemiz gerekiyor. Hikayesi de etkileyici ama umduğum kadar olmadı. Infinite ile benzer aslında bütün aşırı ideolojiler kötüdür. Oyunun bir kısmını şuan ki ABD' de görebilirsiniz. Çin' in büyümesine karşı çeşitli ekonomik kısıtlamalar çıkardı. Ama oyun 4-5 saat daha kısa sürmeliydi. (Hiçbir detayı atlamadan oynama stili ile.) Ortalarında aynı Infinite' deki gibi sokayım yapacağınız işe ben sadece buradan kurtulmak istiyorum diyorsunuz. Fakat hikayenin sonunu beğenmedim. İki kıytırık ara sahne ile bitmemeliydi oyun. Infinite nasıl beyin gıncıklayan sonu ile böyle ekrana mal mal baktırıyorsa buda öyle olmalıydı veyahut daha düzgün animasyonlarla falan bitmeliydi. Çocuk masalı gibi bitiyor düşündükçe uyuz oluyorum. Hatta genel anlamda böyle olmayabilirdi. Andrew Ryan ile birlikte hareket edip Rapture' u kurtardığımız bir hikaye çok daha epik olurdu. Bu haliyle de güzel ama daha iyisini bekliyordum. Şimdide Infinite ile Bioshock' un arasını asıl açan farka gelelim. Elizabeth. Oyunda yanımızda bizimle hareket eden birilerinin olması çok şeyi değiştiriyor. Bu oyunun eksiklerinden biri de bu. İki oyunu karşılaştırınca Bioshock' taki beğenmediğim her şeyi Infinite' de düzeltmişler. Oyun Rapture' u bana sevdirmeyi başardı, Burial at Sea' yi oynayıp o şaşalı günlerini, daha büyük memeli Elizabeth ile beraber görmeyi istiyorum bir an önce. Direk Collection' ı alın oynayın. The game is visually fantastic, and the story is the selling point for this title. 8/10 for a great story and engaging plot. The combat is alright, nothing too fancy.  My two issues with the game are 1) it is not PC-friendly. Meaning, if the game got running it would normally keep running, it only had trouble starting a few times. {"text": "Although like everything in this world, it has its deep ugly flaws: #1. Enemy placement is just blatantly unfair and disgraceful. If I would like to play a 'realistic gunfight simulator with lotsa tight spaces, cheesy enemy ambushes & constant scripted mobs appearing outta thin air' I would be better off going down my neighborhood at night, you know. But I wouldn't call AI 'dumb', definitely no. Funny thing, I've actually seen some defensive maneuvers and tactical moves by mobs here, so those are definitely not your typical shooting range nobrainers popping up right into the protagonist's crosshair w/out posing any thread just to have their heads popped violently in a bullet time sequence with blood splattering shenanigans and stuff. What I'm saying is that I don't have any issues with AI, I simply hate the way enemies are placed on levels. It is in fact an action game, not a simulation like ARMA or smth. And it ain't fun to see Max getting shot over and over and over again because of some pinpoint accurate wallhacking mob suddenly spawning behind the next turn to roll over in slo-mo like a badass while pre-firing his Colt Commando & effectively headshotting me like we're in a freaking Matrix. #2. The game gradually becomes a 'Quicksave fest' towards the end.  And it's not just about enemies, it's about scripted events as well. Like that moment when Max has to jump on the train, or the Casa di Angelo level, or the elevator shaft scene, or the final showdown against Horne's agents M79'ing me to pieces the next second the cutscene stops. But with all those unquestionably wrong moments when I wanted to throw my PC outta window and TP Remedy's office with the nastiest of toilet paper, I want to make it clear that this game left me satisfied and thrilled after finishing it. Unique noir atmosphere, mix of John Woo & Twin Peaks, 4th wall breaks, norse mythos, James McCaffrey's amazing performance and addicting gunplay make it a masterpiece to me. Besides, the pacing is precise; devs got a great sense of humor; dialogues and pop culture references are superb; levels are well-detailed and carefully constructed (while also providing observant players with hidden supplies and even easter eggs!). I also truly appreciate the minimalistic approach devs took in making the UI: there's no minimap or objective pop-up to follow, and nothing distracts the player from exploring surroundings in-between dispatching the enemies and traversing levels bit by bit. With its few (but hitting so painfully) downsides, and all the pros outweighing the cons, I rate it a  . But if I were to score it in a more traditional way, I would give it a  .", "appid": "12140", "steamid": "profiles/76561198007497145", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "13", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1547208000.0}

{"text": "I'm not one to play pixle rpg game such as this but since I had recieved it as a bundle I decided to give it a go. My experience with RPGs have always been leveling up, fighting monsters, or completing some mission, which for the most part is not included in this game and the fact that this game is a story driven one. However, this is not a bad thing because this game does allow you and the main character to level up more on a personality level that is not recorded but more developed in your head as a play style. There are some minor choices in the game and some major choices in the game that affect the outcome that you get at the end. There are some parts of this game that left a bad taste becasue of the boringness and very flat dialouge, however these are eclipsed by the more plentyful colourful parts of the game where you are constantly thinking about what to do and what to say becasue you want to find out what happens next. As for the graphics the art work was neat and I liked it but what really caught my attention was the music, even on the most mundane task the music kept me playing. {"text": "When looking at the Steam awards and was told to choose a game that I wasn't expecting the tear up at, I naturally thought of this game. I'm also writing this review because I am in love with this game and I would like to say why. The game allows you to make decisions that can potentially make all the difference later on. Having played through this game several times, I've noticed that even something you say early on in the game can make a difference to a coversation with a character later on. Your decisions will affect the opinions other characters have on you, which makes you feel involved.  Personally, I prefer the game over the TV series and comics. I may well be a minority for it but the reason being is that I feel more involved in the story, which makes me care more for the characters. Making choices on who to save will make an impact on character relationships. I don't think Telltale got enough credit for their detail in characters such as Clementine, Lee, Carley, Doug, Kenny etc. I'm glad Telltale took their own route and made their own character's for their Telltale series.  When I began to play this game a few years back, I had very little knowledge on what the game was about. I brought the game because I liked the concept of the decision making. {"text": "Это платформер с понятной механикой, с приятным графическим оформлением и забавным сюжетом. Несмотря на всё это, играется это реально потно. Но от этого и интересно. Если коротко, то вы ниндзя, который живёт-бывёт себе - никого не трогает. Потом внезапно вас встречает пират по имени Александр Родионович Бородач (а-ля Эгман). Говорит, что украл всех животных и сделает из них роботов. А нас заставит проходить его испытания. В общем, произошел киднэппинг - и вы уже на борту Бородача. На этом летающем корабле вы встретите его помощников.  С ними было интересно разговаривать. Персонажи получились живым, а сюжет, хоть и простой, но всё же интересный. Поэтому на этом мой сказ заканчивается. Игровой процесс прост. Персонаж умеет прыгать. Дважды прыгать. Ударять катаной и кидать сюрикены. Дано 10 секунд. И цель - уничтожить всех роботов. Уровни, условно говоря, поделены на главы. И доступ к ним открывается по мере прохождения предыдущих уровней на определенное количество звезд. То есть, если вы недостаточно эффективно прошли уровень, то кукишь вам, а не продолжение сюжета. Нужно примерно 65% от звезд, чтобы открыть что-то новое. С каждым паком уровней открывается новые препятствия, которые усложняют, так называемый, ребус. Но не критично.  Помимо основного контента, есть ещё доп задание от тянки на сбор диска с игрой. Можно найти костюмершу в одной из комнат. Можно найти недоброжелательного человека, который скажет, что вертел нашу дружбу. А есть ещё Бенджи, который очень приставучий тип, но очень искренний. После сюжетки вам откроются бонусы и режим марафона. А также старые уровни. В общем, контент для того, кто ещё не наигрался. В целом, мне хватило основного контента и беглый осмотр дополнительного. Игрой остался доволен. Сложно, но интересно.  Вкусно, но попе больно. {"text": "Ostatnio zagrałam w grę utrzymaną w konwencji horroru. Trochę się obawiałam, ale całkiem niepotrzebnie. Jaka super zabawa i ile adrenaliny w grze: Dead by Daylight!  Najlepsza tego typu gra na wesoło, chociaż wygląda bardzo strasznie. A tak bardziej na poważnie to jest to survival horror z asymetrycznym trybem rozgrywki wieloosobowej z 2016 r. Chodzi o to, że jeden gracz zabójca staje do rozgrywki przeciwko zazwyczaj czterem uciekinierom. Jego zadaniem jest uniemożliwienie właśnie uciekinierom wydostania się z zamkniętej mapy. Aby ucieczka był możliwa, gracze muszą naprawić i włączyć odpowiednią liczbę generatorów prądu. Wtedy będzie można otworzyć drzwi i uciec na zewnątrz. Niestety nie jest to takie łatwe, bo zabójca czuwa, aby każdego wbić na hak, a w konsekwencji zabić i zniszczyć naprawione generatory. Rozgrywka trwa do momentu ucieczki przez drzwi lub ukryty właz albo gdy wszyscy uciekinierzy zginą. Po zakończonej rozgrywce gracze otrzymują punkty krwi (odpowiednik punktów doświadczenia) do wydania na dalsze rozwijanie wybranej postaci. Akcja odbywa się na jednej z dwudziestu dwóch losowo wybranych mapach, na której znajdują się różnego typu przeszkody i znajdźki. Zabójca widzi świat z perspektywy pierwszej osoby, natomiast uciekający z perspektywy trzeciej osoby. Tak więc nie ma nudy i jest co robić. Gracze po obu stronach mają możliwość wybrania postaci, którą chcą kierować w grze. Na początku bardzo się bałam i byłam przerażona... Ale pierwsze koty za płoty i potem już tylko niesamowite emocje i śmiech. Najlepiej grać ze znajomymi w party i konieczny jest komunikator, gdyż w tej grze współpraca ułatwia wygraną. Gierka wręcz śmiga na pececie i jest świetnie. Gorąco polecam. W mojej ocenie 10/10. {"text": "8=======3------", "appid": "730", "steamid": "profiles/76561198404391344", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1562155200.0}
{"text": "It is truly a great and flawless game, I personally love every single aspect of it, be it gameplay, story, graphics, visuals, mechanics and etc. What I especially like is that, at the beginning it's much more of a survival so you'll have to avoid zombies as much as you can, as you level up and progress towards story, you'll unlock many various items/skills/gadgets that it may even turn the game into piece of cake on normal difficulty, of course if you invest some time and enjoy the game instead of rushing quests. You can also change difficulty anytime. Gameplay heavily adapts on your skills, weapons and story progression. It's really interesting how you level up, unlock game changing skills and slowly develop your character by finding better weapons, upgrading and crafting with even more deadly upgrades.  Dying Light sometimes reminds me of Skyrim, and all that huge amount of fun I had from it. If you've played and liked Skyrim, you're most likely to enjoy the Dying Light.  You have total of 5 skill trees. From the beginning you'll have three, Survivor, which you gain by completing quests, saving survivors, delivering air drop packages and etc. Agility which you gain by running, jumping, climbing and harder the obstance more experience you earn. And power, you gain power experience by killing zombies with any weapons. Fourth skill tree would be Legend which I've explained below, fifth skill tree is a Driver which is only accessible in The Following DLC.  Dying Light has a decent and serious plot. It is a very interesting, memorable and enjoyable, there might be some plot twists and sad moments. The ending is very exciting and satisfying. But be warned, story isn't the best side of Dying Light, it's gameplay.  Saving system is simple but there's no manual saving. Though almost on everything you do, auto save is triggered, as well upon quitting. I've never lost anything due to saving. Big missions have their own checkpoints. Upon dying or reloading save, you'll spawn in area depending on which quest you have selected or in safe zone.  There's huge weapons choice. Axes, machetes, knives, swords, scythes, katana, great axes/swords and etc. Throwable weapons such as shuriken, want to be ninja? well you can. As well as ranged weapons, pistols, revolvers, SMGs, assault rifles, shotguns, bows and crossbows. Each kind of weapons have quality tiers. Melee weapons have durability and repairs, that means you cannot keep repairing single melee weapon infinitely, it'll eventually downgrade and break.  It is the bows and crossbows, and their awesome and smooth mechanics. Also the fact that you can pickup and reuse the arrows/bolts which is really fun. You'll never run out of arrows this way, unless you're forced to flee from the area being unable to retrieve arrows. Bows and Crossbows never downgrade and since you can pickup arrows/bolts, you can always use them if you run out of firearm ammo or your melee weapon breaks. You can also craft arrows, even elemental arrows, also buy them from merchants.  Over 1,000+ hours so far, and not even a single game breaking bug, of course I've encountered some minor glitches but they weren't really worth much of a trouble, in fact I can't even remember any of it now. Actually it was fun.  Legend skill tree is a great addition to the Dying Light, it came with Enhanced Edition. Once you max out one of your Survivor/Agility/Power skill trees, you'll unlock a Legend skill tree, all the experience gained from that skill-tree then goes towards the Legend, which adds 250 extra levels and a great opportunity to invest some more time in Harran. Legend skills are greatly useful in Nightmare difficulty.  And I mean it, I've started The Following DLC after 700+ hours, beaten the base game multiple times, still going for more.  They've upgraded the game to the Enhanced Edition totally for free. And if you purchase the game now you also get ALL the DLC to date, except Harran Ranger, Gun Psycho and Volatile Hunter bundles, though these 3 are very cheap and not really necessary to enjoy the game. You also get everything that's included in season pass. My score would be 10+/10. Some other things you may like.", "appid": "239140", "steamid": "profiles/76561198061596605", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "275", "votes_funny": "8", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1478260800.0}

{"text": "Как Вы знаете, игры бывают совершенно разные, особенно, по смысловой своей нагрузке. Графика - само собой разумеющееся, лично для меня. Именно в этой игре, Warframe, для меня все просто идеально. Хотя я и признаюсь, в первой версии отзыва пытался завалить игру, но сейчас хочу немного исправить то, что было написано ранее.  Тут тебе и: - Большое количество самого разнообразного оружия ( ближний бой, дальний, пистолеты, крылья для полёта в космосе, оружие к ним и так далее ) - Огромное количество миссий, в том числе и сюжетных ( сейчас сюжетная линия всё дальше и дальше развивается, порождая много интересных подробностей, как развивается и проект - и это хорошо )  - Разнообразный выбор варфреймов ( костюмов главного героя, через которые он транслирует в мир свои способности ), есть, так сказать, на любой вкус и цвет ( у каждого свои уникальные возможности, а после последних обновлений все больше шансов сделать свой костюм неповторимым и таким, каким заблагорассудится в пределах возможностей игры и вашей фантазии ), Отдельного внимания стоит уделить крафту ( созданию ) предметов. Крафтится там все, что только можно. Начиная оружием и заканчивая шлемами для костюмов. Однако, не все так просто, потому что нужно собрать ресурсы, а некоторые нужно скрафтить. В общем... порочный круг своего рода, однако, интересный, но направленный на таймкиллинг - это, конечно, и есть минус этого крафта, хотя, т Если вы хотите повысить ранг вашего оружия, к примеру, меча, то вам нужно как можно больше использовать его в бою. Система прокачки на мой взгляд, очень запутанная, и описать ее в кратце не получится, поэтому играйте, и разбирайтесь сами :) Если вам это интересно, то вы можете поискать подробную информацию на других источниках, к примеру, в группах ВКонтакте, или же фан-сайтах. Там вы сможете найти темы Вопрос-Ответ, туториалы, а так же полезные статейки. Так же, вы можете воспользоваться специальной Варфрейм-вики. На старте игры вам открыты миссии только на планете Миркурий, однако, чем больше вы выполняете заданий, тем дальше вы движитесь по солнечной системе, помимо планет, вы будете попадать на большие и маленькие спутники. Миссий много, и они очень даже разнообразные, к примеру, есть миссии, где нужно просто зачистить объект, так же есть миссии где надо спасать заложников, или же разрушать оборудование. Цель вашего задания может поменяться прямо в процессе игры, а это очень интересно и разнообразно. Вы можете играть как в одиночную компанию, так и играть со случайными людьми, или же с вашими друзьями, что будет, как быстрее, так и безопаснее. Некоторые миссии вы просто не сможете пройти сами, намного легче, когда ваш товарищ может вас воскресить. {"text": "纪录片式的平台解谜游戏，氛围渲染出色，穿插的因纽特文化唯美短片很有趣，推荐通关。另外全成就简单。 最大的亮点在于氛围的渲染十分出色，图像用u3d显得简陋，但景色层次感强，另外动物动作细节逼真，音效仿佛让人身临其境。 故事稍显平淡，毕竟是通过象牙雕的简单图像和代代口口相传的传说，细节损失太多。制作者并未采用大开脑洞的方式补完，而是通过纪录短片的方式丰富内容，虽然情节缺乏起伏但保持了故事的原汁原味，对于偏向介绍因纽特文化的游戏来说个人觉得是利大于弊的。谜题偏简单，由于需要切换角色合作故还算有趣，boss战需要一点操作但不是很复杂。 缺点则是操作略显蛋疼，稍有延迟（u3d的通病），至于有人抱怨的流星索难用因为操作是为手柄而设计，我用的是one的手柄故问题不大。另外还有出城的bug（卡进墙），不过我碰到的都能在边缘跳回来，偶尔会挂，好在自动存盘点够多，没损失多少进度。 成就分两类：通关和解锁短片（很好找）。如果有无伤通关的话势必将操作和出城的缺点放大，好在制作组并未加入。另外建议解锁影片就立即观看，影片很短不会影响游戏节奏，而且内容与当前关卡切合。我是全解锁后集中看的，前面通关的印象都没那么深了。 总体来看制作组挺会扬长避短的，虽未解决不足之处（换引擎太难），但通过相关因素的补充来减少缺点的冲击，所以游戏体验还挺好。", "appid": "295790", "steamid": "profiles/76561198026492008", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "7", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1457006400.0}

{"text": "Hachja was soll man über dieses wundervolle Spiel sagen? Es ist absoluter Müll! Aber genau das macht das Spiel so unterhaltsam. Grundsätzlich ist es ein guter 2. Weltkriegsshooter, ist aber voller bugs und genau die machen das Spiel so witzig. Der Singleplayer ist in ein paar Stunden durchgespielt. Erst spielt man auf der Seite der Achsenmächte und kämpft sich Richtung Osten ... dann spielt man auf Seite der Sowjetunion und drängt die Deutschen zurück nach Westen. Man spielt exakt die gleichen Karten nur eben auf der anderen Seite. Das fand ich schon ein wenig schwach um ehrlich zu sein. Aber es ist schon witzig wenn man auf Seiten der Russen spielt und ein Genosse \"Ivan STIRB!\" ruft oder eben auf Seiten der Wehrmacht ein Kamerad plötzlich anfängt Russisch zu labern. Aber man muss dazu auch sagen, dass es ein RELATIV realistisches Kriegsspiel ist, da sollte man sich nicht von der für das Jahr 2011 recht schlechte Grafik nicht täuschen lassen. Wenn man verwundet ist muss man sich selbst verarzten, wenn man zu stark verwundet wurde krüppelt man noch kurz durchs Geschehen bevor man dann verblutet. Zur Gegner-KI muss ich sagen, dass sie ziemlich dumm ist. Ich weiß nicht ob sie zu oft vom Wickeltisch gefallen sind oder schon so geboren wurden, aber teilweise könnte man schnell an den Gegnerhorden vorbeisprinten und die reagieren erst wenn man schon weg ist. Auch wird kaum drauf reagiert wenn man den Gegner verwundet hat.  Auf der anderen Seite: Wenn sie (zumindest auf höheren Schwierigkeitsgraden) einen erstmal im Visier haben hast du ein Problem. Dann heißt es geh in Deckung oder wenn keine da ist \"RUN FOREST RUN\". Der Multiplayer ist da schon etwas anders, solang man echte Spieler auf dem Server hat und dieser nicht massiv mit Bots gefüllt werden muss damit er nicht leer ist. Wobei das mit den Bots auch ganz witzig ist, wenn man noch andere Spieler im Team hat. So habe ich viele schöne Stunden mit ein paar Freunden auf den Servern verbracht und die meiste Zeit haben wir uns über TeamSpeak dann über das Spiel lustig gemacht. Aber eben das hat sau viel Spaß gemacht. Ansonsten kann man schon sagen, es bockt. Wenn das Spiel mal im Angebot ist, ist es auf jeden Fall einen Kauf wert. Den vollen Preis von derzeit 17,99€ würde ich es aber nicht kaufen. Wenn einem eine relativ schlechte Grafik und einige lustige Fehler im Spiel nichts ausmachen und man es mit Humor nimmt, kann es durchaus eine Menge Spaß machen! {"text": "While still suffering slightly from the uninteresting late game that has been a part of much of the Total War(TW) franchise history this fantasy entry is one of the most re-playable. My particular favorite being the Wood Elves, though the addition of Skarsnik to the \"Greenskins\" with a wonderfully goblin centric roster for devious skullduggery at the expense of any real staying power is a great challenge and close second. {"text": "Wow, I mean just wow.  I mean seriously, do I even need to state how good the game is?  I understand some peoples predisposition against the game since it is VR only, but, you have to experience the game to understand why it fits best in VR and it is worth it.  With a flat-screen version, you would not only loose the deep immersion HLA's atmosphere puts you in, but also a lot of features that would be more tedious and annoying on a flat-screen version are instead fun and exciting in VR.  Valve knew they wouldn't get good feedback if they ♥♥♥♥ out some crap, non-physics based VR cash grab, but this is far, FAR from anything even remotely close to that.  You start off in an incredibly detailed area with an astonishing view, interactable objects everywhere and even in the first moments of the game you get to understand why this is belongs in VR.  On a flat screen version, you can't really feel how heavy an item is, but in here, when you pick up something like a watering can, you can tell the weight difference immediately from a can of soda or a box.  The game so far has had a great story line and a great pace of story development.  Almost all dialogue so far has been enjoyable and not at all immersion breaking and really shows off a lot of Alyx and company's characters.  Moving on to level design, where should I even begin?  Every single room looks as if it has been meticulously designed and had hours upon hours that could rack up into multiple days poured into it.  I can't even put into words how good of a job the level designers did on this game, let alone the entire dev team that worked on this.  If you watched any interview with Robin Walker(or any VNN video related to the topic), specifically the interview conducted by Geoff Keighley, then you would know that they analyzed all of the play testers actions, and learned from what they did.  They changed the game according to how they played and reacted, so every level, every room, every single item that was placed and positioned had the player in mind and how are you going to react to it.  This Resulted in the best level design in a VR game I have ever played, and will be so for years to come.  Please, If you have VR, you NEED to get this title, and please, once you realize how great of a game this is leave a good review too because this will help show the dev team that they need to keep creating outstanding, tremendous games like this [no pressure though dev team :) ]   The only thing I would say that is \"negative\" is that there are a couple of the bugs at the moment.  For a fully physic based game that just released(and compared to the amount of bugs in the V1 version of HL2 and other VR titles), the amount of bugs that I have experienced so far is low, but there are still some.  There have been a couple of janky things that happen, like dropping something in a certain position or the hands messing up when grabbing certain objects, but these are to be expected in a AAA game that just released, mind you it's also in VR, where the player has a lot of more ways to mess with the game and make a situation where things will be wonky.", "appid": "546560", "steamid": "profiles/76561198022886574", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1584964800.0}

{"text": "The biggest problem this game has is that the cars have too much grip on gravel. This makes it really hard to slide and to induce throttle overstear. Group B cars in rallycross. + Has Landrush. + You can make your own livery. Everything looks the same. - Some locations are way too easy, like Michigan. You have to drive like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ if you manage to crash there. - Graphics looks worse than DR. - Very annoying co-drivers. Especially what they're saying before and after a stage. - Random stage generator isn't very good. - Music is horrible. Had to turn it off. - TOO MUCH GRIP. These are rally cars, I want to slide ffs! They made some good changes to the physics but also some bad, like the grip. This makes the cars boring to drive. I recommend that you get Dirt Rally instead, or maybe WRC 7. Edit: I still recommend this game, but it has some problems as I've stated above. If you've never played Dirt Rally, I suggest that you buy that game first. {"text": "Recommended, good story. Put aside a few hours and play the game from start to finish in one sitting.", "appid": "501300", "steamid": "profiles/76561197984330139", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "3", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1526472000.0}
{"text": "RosePortal Games kept up their standards in terms of Audio in this game as well. Excellent music as with their previous game. A unique blend of characters, the usual stereotypical characters where we are accustomed to is thrown out the window. The Spell caster, Tanker, Damage Dealer etc. where the characters strengths and weaknesses don't overlap so it's pretty much direct. Controls:The standard WASD or Arrow Keys for navigation of your party. \"Space\" button acts as the select/enter/interact key. Shift and Control brings you to the different parts of the UI within the game. With \"Shift\" button brings you to Right Hand-side of the UI Menu ie. Crafting, Save, Load, Diary (Quest Log), Shutdown (Exit Game) etc. As for \"Control\" button navigates you to the UI menu that is on the bottom of your screen where you access potions and other consumables. Combat The usual RPG-Maker's turn-based combat system. There's the familiar Attack, Magic, Items or Defend movement choices. As per previous RosePortal Game, Princess' Heart, this is where most of the fun is had for strategy & party management lovers. You will make decisions as whether to play aggressively to finish the battle as quickly as possible to earn a 3 star rating which will give you items to max up your HP & Magic or defensively/cautiously without risking losing the battle but forsaking the HP & Magic boost. Depending on you character's speed stat with the higher one's leading the initiative in moving first. However this leaves you guessing the enemies' turn order and who has a higher speed stat compared to your units.After each battle for the very first time, you will receive craftable rewards that will enable you to craft a wide range of potions to use for upcoming encounters. This is where it is different from the recent title and a very much welcoming aspect. It gives you a purpose to challenge every enemy you encounter to not only gain XP to level up but use those winnings to craft items. Non-Combat One gripe within the game is the amount of track back you will find yourself in at times. The map layout for the various locations has a few paths for you to navigate within, for some of them it'l require you to obtain and item or do an action in a certain location before you can proceed. So if you choose the path that is locked up until you go elsewhere to open up that said area, expect a lot of tracking back. Being an RPG-Maker game, it is expected that the options to be limited.The game options has the standard difficulty, graphic qualitymusic & sound volume settings & adjustments you can make. What is welcomed in the option to censor the jokes, this is good for the younger audiences. Another thing that is good is the option to have the minimap opaque or not. However also do note that there isn't an option to rebind keys.A minor negative when it comes to the options is that when full screen is selected, it doesn't remember your choice the next time you boot up the game at times & it scales back to windowed. Also to note that choosing full screen means it'll scale to full screen ie enlarge everything to that size.  A slight variation from the typical RPG-Maker look with almost cartoon-y hand drawn character models which is a tad refreshing to a genre already diluted with same-ish visuals. The environment design and object models are well made, even more than their previous games which is what is expected from the developer, to constantly improve with every game release they make.However as much as I like it, at times you will find yourself unable to tell whether is a certain object in the environment will block your way or not or when a big tree in the foreground will obscure the pathway in the background that you character is in. A self-aware game where it breaks down the 4th wall in the beginning, which while it is amusing at first but gets old pretty quickly, thankfully it doesn't continue for long. The story starts to pick up from mid-point onwards when the plot will hook in more of your interest and the questions will help motivate you on in the game to find out. Also to note, expect a little adult-content references which are funny at times but just be advised for younger audiences. Another well-made game from RosePortal Games that though doesn't add anything brand new to the genre, they certainly have added another game mechanic successfully to their expanding list of things they've tried and tested. The game runs smoothly & there is nothing wrong or buggy with it so it's a matter whether is it up your alley or not. There's a New Game+ that will welcome completionist 100% the game. Definitely will keep out an eye on their next project to see what's to come from them.", "appid": "392940", "steamid": "profiles/76561198089256397", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "5", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1444219200.0}

{"text": "The Universim is an early access game currently available on Steam. You play as god and guide your people (nuggets) through the dangers and benefits of life. You start off back in the early stone age, all the way up to the modern-day era. You can treat your people however you wish, you can be a mad god punishing the people for not believing in you, or you could be a loving and caring God, taking care of the people and their civilization. As of right now, there are a few game-breaking issues I'm going to more in-depth too. Keep in mind that this game is early access and a lot of features and bugs will change and everything may not be accurate in a couple of months. You start your game off with 2 people, or as the game calls them, nuggets. The nuggets can early on survive by themselves easily without guidance by eating berried, chopping their own wood and drinking from the lakes. Eventually, they're going to fall in love and create a family and get kids. You play as a god, which means that you're able to affect the nugget's feelings and lives. If you wish to make 2 nuggets fall in love, why not? If you wish to throw them into a lake and let them drown? It's up to you. But your most important task is to build infrastructure for the nuggets. Because they cannot build wells, hospitals, and mines by themselves. You need to place the blueprint for them to actually build it. But the nuggets will gather all the basic resources by themselves and build it. The more you play, the further you advance through the tech tree, which will grant you new buffs, resources, upgrades, and buildings. After you've reached a specific section in the game you'll also need to focus on not saving the planet from overpopulation and global warming. This is done by doing eco-friendly decisions such as avoiding the use of coal power and etc. Another important feature to note is the resource upgrading, after a while you're going to unlock wood refineries and stone refineries, that will process stone to bricks and wood to planks. These new resources are going to, later on, be used to build everything, instead of using their raw form. This means if those refineries are destroyed and you've got to the point where you'll need bricks or planks to build them. You won't progress. The game is set at 27'99€ which I find a bit too overpriced when thinking it's an early access game that still needs more polishing. Contentwise it's a decent amount. After researching everything major there isn't much to really do. The game's challenges are probably the game's issue. Wolfpacks can come out of nowhere and you'll have to scavenge the entire planet looking for where the wolfs are, 9/10 times I can't find where the attacks occur and I'll end up losing 2-4 nuggets. The other main challenge I face is if you lose your refinery, you'll have to dig up an old save file or start over. Because you're going to need to build the refineries with the refined resources. Another challenge I noticed early on was that I had to manually repair buildings that were decaying unless I build a lot of engineering huts, that will repair buildings. The game's graphics are really good looking, especially the sky and water reflections. The graphics remind me a bit of city skyline but on a smaller scale and more vibrant colors. Because the map is shaped like a planet, when you zoom out enough you'll also see all the beautiful stars in space. There isn't really anything special with the sound. except that there's an annoying narrator that talks to you every minute or so. I'd recommend to disable it unless you want to be reminded every minute if something happens. The game runs smoothly at 144fps, haven't experienced any stuttering with a decent build. Neither have I had any technical errors, such as crashes and difficulties to start the program. First of all, my main issue is the fact that your progress can get destroyed if your refineries are destroyed because you can't refine resources to build the refineries then. A possible solution for this is for the developers to add the ability to construct the older legacy buildings instead of always being forced to build the highest tier of a building available to you. The other issue I'm experiencing is that when you recieve notifications of a wolf pack attack, you can't warp to the location or see where it's happening. This means that you'll have to scourage through your village to see it. Most of the time, I won't end up finding it and my nuggets will die. My final issue that might be more of a bug than a mechanic is the fact that when reaching medieval age etc. The nuggets homes should upgrade by themselves, but some of them won't. So in the modern-day era. You can have a skyscraper next to a stone cave.  The Universim is a good game that for sure has a lot of potentials. with enough polishing and features, I believe this game could become amazing. As of currently, it's still a really good game, just a couple of issues that may interfere with your gameplay and ruin the experience.", "appid": "352720", "steamid": "profiles/76561198140378650", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "27", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1584360000.0}

I found The Forgotten Sanctum to be the best in both series but Seeker, Slayer, Survivor was very disappointing in its MMO like quests (fetch/kill). - Two aspects that I found POEII dropped the ball was in the companions and the storyline. {"text": "Стоит признать, что за последние годы основой большинства игр стали  приевшиеся и до боли знакомые стереотипы. Спасение принцесс, уничтожение  драконов,борьба со злом. Как все это надоело... так и хочется  сменить сторону и  сжечь доброго короля  и свиту, а  все его королевство разобрать  по кирпичикам. Если  вы, как и я дошли до такой кондиции, то серия  Dungeons  вам поможет. \t  Концепцию  игры за Абсолютное Зло Realmforge Studios  вынашивали  давно. Вышедшая в 2011  первая   Dungeons, несмотря на  все старания и обещания продолжить идеи легендарной  Dungeon Keeper  была сырой, кривой ,недоработанной и попросту скучной. Поэтому во второй части, увидевшей свет в 2015 разработчики решили делать что то свое. И у них  почти получилось. Безумная пародия на все сразу. Великолепный комментатор с остро подвешенным языком  и до абсурда  смешные ситуации  вкупе с интересной идеей игры на двух картах сразу принесли свои плоды, но, чего то  все же не хватало .Все это и была призвана  исправить 3 часть. И она исправила. Как? Что же. Попытаюсь вам ответить.    Концепция игры со времен  второй части  не изменилась.Мы играем за Абсолютное Зло - мрачного повелителя подземелья, стремящегося уничтожить  все добро  в этом мире.  Как оказалось,во 2 части мы уничтожили не всех.Зло, к неописуемой дял себя радости   находит  новый континент,пригодный для разорения.Есть где разгуляться! Что же. Цели ясны, миссия выполнима.  Но, как всегда происходит небольшая проблема.   Весь наш флот тонет (дважды). Поэтому, для захвата мира нам требуется чья то  помощь. Выбор падает на Талию.  Страдающую раздвоением личности   темную эльфийку. Вместе с этой острой на язык злодейкой нам предстоят новые свершения во имя самих себя. Основная суть серии, как и игры всегда строилась вокруг подземелья : вашей базы,оплота,пристанища. Называйте его как хотите. Именно здесь  вы создаете  свои войска,  добываете несметные сокровища,пытаете  геров,да и вообще занимаетесь чем угодно( а выбор велик, хватило бы на все места). Описывать  все прелести игры долго, да и места нам не хватит. Пройдемся тезисно. That being said the level desing kinda doesn't give you much opportunity to explore, it feels kinda restricted, like if you're playing a CoD game. {"text": "Point & click adventure game about the 10-year old girl who is committed to asylum after witnessing violent murders of her parents. Yeah, not a typical game of this genre. Instead of cheery characters and lighthearted themes, here you will encounter mental illness, medical mistreatment and their consequences. Story is compelling and will keep you nailed to the chair until you finished it. Narrative can be interpreted in two ways, and is left to the players which one they want to believe is \"real\". Gameplay is classic p&c with using right item at the right place. Puzzles lean to the easy side and thus are welcomming to less experienced players in the genre. Veterans will probably storm through them but nevertheless enjoy in game since the focus is on the story. {"text": "Когда игра начинается, на фоне пасторального задника появляется типа алхимик-рассказчик, и начинает вводить нас в курс дела, объясняет как и что делать. Это плюс. Минус, что он это делает на английском. Плюс, что текст крайне простой и понятный. В общем такое. Открываем инвентарь, в котором у нас будет всякая всячина, которая туда будет падать за выполнение успешных заданий, и чудо - слово \"Инвентарь\" почему то написано на русском языке. Почему? Не понятно, впрочем это единственное русское слово, которое я увидел в игре. А задания, которые нам надо выполнять, что бы в инвентарь падал лут - просто угадывание пар оданаковых карточек на время. Они отличаются друг от друга темами картинок, которые мы увидим - \"растения\", \"насекомые\", \"рыбы\", \"животные\" и так далее. В зависимости от того, в какой тип карточек мы поиграем, нам выпадет соответствующий лут - рыба, гриб, насекомое или что то другое. В этом вся \"алхимия\" игры. Выпавший лут можно \"использовать\". Вверху есть полоска, которая показывает что то типа энергии, каких то ресурсов, но я совершенно не понял, зачем это всё нужно. Алхимик остановился и дальше не вёл свой рассказ, предлагая нажать какую то кнопку действия. Единственная кнопка действия, которую я видел, предлагала мне сыграть снова и снова в одни и те же игры с карточками, среди которых затесалась другая, где мы могли сыграть с орком в кости. Эта игра ни на что не влияла и ничего не давала, после каждого раунда появлялась кнопка, предлагающая вернуться к фарму. Однако я совершенно не понял что нам этот фарм даёт, какое развитие геймплея игра нам ещё готовит, как весь этот лут должен использоваться в дальнейшем. Алхимии я что-то не увидел, но поиграть в карточки можно, в перерывах на работе, впрочем только если у вас есть возможность установить там Стим и эту игру. Ещё стоит поработать над музыкой, две музыкальные темы, играющие каждая на своём экране, быстро надоедают. В общем, я думаю, это ещё очень ранний доступ, только заготовка для дальнейшего развития, и когда всё это появится в будущем, игра станет очень интересной.", "appid": "610670", "steamid": "profiles/76561198053979626", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "5", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1502107200.0}
