"oͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦoͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦͦo {"text": "Раньше World of Tanks управлялись с клавиатуры и мыши, или, на худой конец, с многокнопочного контроллера Xbox 360, а теперь эту функцию на себя взяли тач-экраны. И они справляются с ней, скажем так, по-хорошему предсказуемо. С одной стороны, мы не испытывали какого-то особого дискомфорта при скоростном маневрировании или прицельной пальбе по неприятелю. Особенно, если предварительно настроить чувствительность камеры и поворотов под себя. С другой стороны, о реальной отзывчивости тут и речи не могло идти. По итогам получилось достаточно удобно и комфортно, чтобы не ворчать всякий раз, когда в вашу машину зацепит очередной вражеский выстрел. Но, как всегда, разработчикам есть, к чему стремиться. компьютерная и консольная версии «Танков» сильно отличались внешне. Адепты клавиатуры и мыши получили практически стерильную и серую картинку, а владельцы Xbox 360 – изображение с кислотными красками и выкрученным донельзя контрастом. Что поделаешь: на PC ценится «реализмЪ», а на приставках – живописная и запоминающаяся обертка. Портативный проект расположился где-то посередине. Он, вроде бы, ближе к PC-итерации, но так и норовит поиграть излишне яркими бликами и сочными взрывами на фоне предзакатного солнца. И если о художественном дизайне Blitz можно посудачить вечерок-другой в компании виртуальных сослуживцев, то к жизненно важной в онлайне производительности нет никаких вопросов. На редакционном iPad 2 игрушка, как любят говорить на форумах, «летала» на 50-60 кадрах в секунду, а пинг держался во вполне приемлемых рамках. Эксперимента ради мы даже потестили портативные «Танки» в одном из московских кафе, где качество интернета явно далеко от идеального – и все, что любопытно, работало без перебоев. World of Tanks Blitz – вероятно, идеальная адаптация нашумевшего хита под iOS-устройства. Все при ней: скрупулезно переложенная боевая механика, вполне понятный и доступный среднестатистическому пользователю менеджмент, обилие модификаций и апгрейдов и, что особенно круто, молниеносный коннект непосредственно к экшену. Без шуток и преувеличений: пара секунд с момента входа в приложение, и вот вы уже протираете гусеницами промерзшую лесополосу времен Второй Мировой. Учитывая мобильный формат – это вдвойне удивительно. И, тем не менее, «Танки» – это вещь себе и не для всех. Темп карманного издания ближе к приставочному релизу – более шустрый и менее позиционный, чем на PC, но и он вряд ли привлечет массовую аудиторию. Неточное управление и обилие всевозможных улучшений, повешенных на донат, тоже вряд ли порадуют охочих до справедливости игроков. Но если вы самозабвенно откатали не одну сотню километров в оригинальной World of Tanks, то знайте – здесь вас ждет, ровным счетом, все тоже самое. {"text": "С чего начать? А я без понятия... Но все-же надо а то наиграл 630 часов и ничего не знаю что сказать.  Если брать с минусов то по моему он один и всем он известен... Оптимизацыя... Но можно отдать разработчикам должное ибо работают не покладая рук. (По сравнению с другими играми.) Сравнивать с другими играми не стоит ибо это отдельная история... А что в ней есть?  -Да, тут есть строительство. Можно построить хоть замок хоть город НО при этом сильно упадет ФПС изза количества построек и будет затруднительно зайти на сервер. -Приручить почти любое существо в игре. Благо их уже более 90 видов и список растет. Приручайте катайтесь летайте плавайте. -Уровни прокачки довольно просты но не ждите что выучите все навыки. Одному не осилить не считая модификацый. -Приключений просто многое множество. Хоть в пещеры ходи хоть под воду ныряй. -Серверы двух типов ПВЕ и ПВП. На ПВП можно все без исключений. Можно убивать на лево и направо но и вас может убить любой встречный. Можно рушить постройки но и опять-же вашу тоже могут пустить под ноль. На ПВЕ нельзя убивать друг друга и рушить постройки тоесть миру-мир. -Можно сходится в кланы и выживать хоть вдвоем хоть толпой человек в тридцать. И опять-же НО есть всякие люди которые и в спину копьецом вам потыкать не против и из клана могут выкинуть и все забрать себе. Так что только со своими выживаем и только с проверенными ибо потом куча негатива в адрес игры хотя она тут уже не виновата а все зависит от вас и ваших друзей. Есть кстати еще один мод в котором вы выживаете по принцыпу голодных игр. В котором вы выживаете в паре с другим игроком и останется только один. И в завершение можно сказать что ДА игра не идеальна ДА в ней слабенькая оптимизацыя но эта зараза затягивает. Обновления чють ли не 4 раза в день. По крайней мере когда я ее покупал она еле шла и на сервер я заходил спустя минут 40 а сейчас и пяти минут не проходит. Спасибо за вынимание и опять-же звиняйте за ошибки... И всеже не выдержал и добавлю кое что об оптимизации...  Народ. Ее не ждите по крайней мере по 3 - 4 причинам. 1 - Слабое железо. ( Если у вас такой же аппарат как у меня то как минимум на низких можете попробовать но ее не будет.) 2 - Загаженность сервера. ( Конечно если на сервере 100500 плотов на море или столько же костерков на 1кв/м ну или трудолюбивые китайци выстроили базу на пол карты то откаты и провисания можно ожидать.) 3 - Слабый интернет. ( Тут без комментов. ) Ну а четвертый вариант не помню да и этого всего достаточно и кстати если у вас все эти пункты то лучше проходите и не задерживайтесь а то пополните ряды страждущих оптимизации как большинство владельцев данной игры и да... Никого обидеть не пытаюсь а просто хочю сказать что оптимизация в игре есть но она не для наших компов-интернета.  У меня все. Всем великой 60ки и меньше загаженных серверов. Лівий як тач не використовую взагалі - вічно стоїть як хрестовина. Правий - завжди в настройках як миша. Відгук і чутливість - ідеал. Для оффлайн шутерів саме те. Можна грати і онлайн, якщо звикнути, правда я в онлайн шутерах і так не сильний. Фішку з вібро відключив зразу, залишив лише на курку. Курки двохступеневі. Тобто можна забіндити на сильне і слабке натискання дві дії. Переважно це прицілювання і постріл. Кількість кнопок: 4 на лівому тачпаді, 5 на правому (одна якщо використовуєш к тач-панель і 4 як хрестовина), 6 (4) на передній панелі, дві біля кнопки включення, одна під стіком, дві знизу. Ітого 20 кнопок. Плюс можливість налаштування переключання режимів прямо посеред гри, тобто комбінацій безліч. Гіроскоп - гоночки наше все. Можна пограти і в шутери з ним (Valve пропонує його як точний приціл, і в їхніх шутерах це дійсно зручно). Але я використовую суто в гонках. Відчувається набагато краще ніж на планшетиках, але виглядає приблизно так само - ти крутиш перед собою геймпад, а люди не розуміють що з тобою не так =) Комплектація - Контроллер, дві американські duracell (за майже місяць не сіли і на 1 відсоток), кабель usb, usb-докстанція, документики. До якості зборки претензій нема, нічого не скрипить і не рипить. Кнопки трошки гучні, могли б бути тихішими. Висновок: Колись друг дав спробувати скайрім на геймпаді (аналог xbox від logitech) - я ні разу не попав з лука в щось рухливе. З цим геймпадом я з другої спроби ставлю хедшоти в Unreal Tournament. Якщо в вас ще немає геймпада, але ви задумуєтесь над покупкою - беріть GabePad :D З.І. Перший хороший продукт вальве після L4D2. {"text": "Il était une fois Miami, la Floride et ses palmiers, sa chaleur et son opulence. Un homme, anonyme, reçoit d'étranges coups de fil concernant des livraisons \"spéciales\". Vêtu de son blouson universitaire il monte dans sa Delorean, il a le culte chevillé au corps et il remonte le temps pour nous. Destination : 1989, ambiance électronique et bigarrée, période post Disco et pré Grunge. Terre et époque de tous les excès, de toutes les outrances. Derrière des masques grotesques notre avatar sans nom s'en va massacrer des mafieux, poussé par cette voix inconnue au téléphone. Couteau, marteau, batte, shotgun, machette... le sang gicle, la cervelle éclabousse les murs, les tripes se répandent sur le sol. Au son de puissantes mélodies électroniques les cadavres sans têtes et les membres arrachés se mêlent au carrelage kitsch et aux tapis criards pour transformer le décor acidulé en théâtre des horreurs. Les coups de couteau comme les coups de feu doivent être précis, efficaces et meurtriers. One shot, one kill, la toute puissance se fait sentir lorsque les victimes s'enchaînent. One shot, one kill, le joueur sur un pied d'égalité avec ses cibles. One shot, one kill, pas le droit à l'erreur. La moindre balle est fatale, le moindre coup dans le vent et c'est la sanction immédiate, la cervelle qui éclabousse les murs sera la notre. Aussi rapide que la mort, le reload de la partie. Recommencer, encore et encore. Recommencer parce qu'on a mal géré les munitions, recommencer car on a mal évalué les distances, recommencer parce qu'on a paniqué, recommencer parce qu'on a voulu aller trop vite. Le compteur de score augmente avec notre frénésie et notre créativité meurtrière mais il nous pousse aussi à la faute. Avoir de bons réflexes est vital, réfléchir au déroulement des évènement l'est tout autant. Hypnotisé par la musique qui pulse dans nos oreilles comme le sang pulse dans nos veines, chaque nouvelle tentative est plus irrésistible que la précédente. La tension ne cesse de monter, les nerfs à vif on ne pourra pas abandonner tant que la soif de sang ne sera pas étanchée. La porte s'ouvre, un homme de main est à terre pour quelques instants, pas le temps de réfléchir, ses deux collègues foncent déjà sur nous. Bang, la chevrotine déchire le torse d'un malfrat, cric-crac, l'étui fumant est éjecté de la chambre, clic, l'arme est vide. Fendant l'air tel un boomerang absurde le shotgun traverse la pièce et vient heurter le deuxième assaillant. La barre de fer qu'il tenait à la main roule jusqu'à nos pieds, le temps de l'attraper, de se retourner. Le premier type, celui mis à terre par la porte, vient juste de se relever et l'intérieur de son crâne voit désormais la lumière du jour pour la première fois. Il reste le troisième mec, inconscient sur le sol après avoir été assommé par le fusil à pompe volant. Un couteau traîne à proximité, inutile de le laisser se relever, la carotide s'ouvre, le sang repeint la moitié de la pièce. Et soudain... Le silence. C'était le dernier ennemi du niveau, en même temps que sa vie, la musique s'éteint et la tension retombe, d'un coup. C'est à ce moment là qu'on se rend compte de la portée viscérale d'Hotline Miami, cette réaction physique que l'on a, ce soulagement d'avoir enfin réussi. Plus le jeu avance et plus notre avatar se perd, aidé en cela par une narration éclatée mais maîtrisée, référentielle (Les crédits de fin remercient Nicolas Winding Refn, ceux ayant vu Drive auront fait le rapprochement d'eux-même) mais pourtant unique. Rêve, réalité, vie, mort, passé, présent, comment, pourquoi... tout se mêle et tout se brouille. Les repères du personnage principal explosent, ceux du joueur aussi, les deux sont plongés dans la même spirale de violence sans concession, dans le même bad trip. L'anti-héros anonyme porte lui même un masque pour perpétrer ses crimes, de la même manière que le joueur se camoufle derrière le personnage de jeu vidéo. Chaque nouveau masque donnera l'occasion de modeler le massacre à son propre style, d'affirmer sa signature macabre. Sado mais maso, jouissif mais tenace, Hotline Miami s'approche au plus près de la folie. Jonatan Söderström et Dennis Wedin, les deux créateurs, s'amusaient pour la promo du titre en placardant \"based on a true story\" dans les différents trailers pour se moquer gentiment de ce type d'exercice. Premier jalon d'une oeuvre grotesque et géniale puisqu' Hotline Miami s'inspire bien d'une histoire vraie, pas celle d'un serial killer des années 80 mais celle du joueur qui y joue.", "appid": "219150", "steamid": "profiles/76561198010228192", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1477310400.0}

{"text": "When I started playing this game I didn’t really know what to expect and I got shocked how amazing this game is. You play as Edith Finch, a 17 year old girl whomst is traveling back to her old house where she used to live until she was 11 years old. So what you do in this game is going around the Finch house and searching for stories as you explore her family history. {"text": "就在我以为VR音游被音盾统治，难有新款出现的时候。 过年期间，我看到了这款游戏的MR视频，光是听节奏，就已经非常带感了。 经过几个月的酝酿，《Beat Saber》火了！现在，几乎有头盔的玩家都想玩。 这个五月，《Beat Saber》就像鸡血一般注入了VR游戏圈，大家都high了起来！ —————————————————————————————— 想要做好一款VR音游，实际上是很有难度的，需要同时做好VR和音游两个方面。 VR方面，沉浸感、视觉冲击力必须要有，画面不能太复杂，否则会影响到玩家视野。 音乐方面，要保证音乐节奏和打击感的完美结合，让每一个难度的玩家都能找到游戏的快感。 但是两者想要结合起来还是有一定的难度，但是一旦做好了那一定是个优秀的VR游戏。 就像16年发布的《音盾》一样，至今任然霸占着VR音游销量榜首，它本身的游戏素质也是有目共睹的。 实际上，从画质上来看，《Beat Saber》没有大作的感觉，几种单色调的单配，简约而不简单。 而这也正是音游和玩家们所需要的，把握好VR音游的核心内容才是最重要的。 说到核心内容，《Beat Saber》的音乐质量非常高。 消息显示，《Beat Saber》请来了暴雪音乐作曲/混音师Jaroslav Beck，行家一出手，玩家们直接high到爆。 不知道有多少玩家就是因为玩了第一首歌《$100 Bills》之后，直接被圈粉的。 有了音乐大师的加持，在游戏体验上《Beat Saber》自然也有了巨大的提升。 简单地说，你会发现，无论你选择哪一个游戏难度，你的每一刀都在音乐的节奏点上。 同时，为了避免简单地站桩玩法破坏VR体验，《Beat Saber》还加入了红色电墙，让玩家整个身体都能动起来。 跟着节奏尽情地晃动身体，那种感觉，就像是在夜店舞池里，真是太奇妙了。 《Beat Saber》还有一个亮点，就是它的挥砍玩法，尽管过去的VR游戏也有类似的设计。 但是，《Beat Saber》有不小的进步，玩家需要看准方块的箭头提示，来完成相应的挥砍动作。 而这些动作，看似没有规律可循，但却和音乐节奏有很大的关系，相信玩过之后你就能明白这一点。 最后，在设备的选择上，在有条件的情况下，VIVE因为手柄重量较重，打击感更强，运动量更大。 而Oculus和微软MR因为手柄重量较轻，所以打击感稍微弱一点，运动量也相对较小。 这一点因人而异吧，当然，只要你有VR设备，那就必须要体验一下这款游戏。 70元的价格，你买不了吃亏，买不了上当，有的只是超高的游戏体验。 等以后《Beat Saber》开放了本地音乐和创意工坊，那它的影响力会变得更强。 相信，很快它就会成为VR玩家必备的音乐游戏。 —————————————————————————————— 过去得每一天，尽管都有VR游戏上线，其中也不乏大型IP作品，但是它们并不适合所有VR玩家。 《Beat Saber》不一样，它们的适用群体非常广，音乐是没有界限的。 这也是为什么它能迅速蹿红，火爆VR游戏圈的原因。 有什么意见和建议请留言告知，我要开始挑战游戏的最高难度了。", "appid": "620980", "steamid": "profiles/76561198089911040", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "114", "votes_funny": "10", "early_access": true, "tstamp_created": 1525348800.0}

{"text": "Tworząc   deweloper postanowił zrobić słuszny pożytek z lekcji wyniesionych z produkcji poprzedniej odsłony. Gra rozwinęła się w paru niezależnych od siebie kierunkach, czerpiąc pełnymi garściami zarówno z własnego charakteru, jak i najnowszych trendów. Oczywiście sednem zabawy w dalszym ciągu jest masakrowanie hord demonów i innych niemilców, jednak koncepcyjnie produkcja rozrosła się w sposób widoczny na pierwszy rzut oka. Do dyspozycji gracza został oddany pół-otwarty świat, co w oczywisty sposób tworzy wrażenie pewnej swobody (chociaż pozwala również na przemycenie nienachalnego backtrackingu). Dodajcie do tego loot, odlotowych bossów, mniej odlotowych, ale wciąż fajnych subbossów, zadania poboczne, dostosowywanie broni, ulepszanie ich, kupowanie przedmiotów, rozwijanie umiejętności, kapliczki, szaloną dynamikę zabawy i parę innych pomniejszych elementów. Dodajmy, że gra jest bardzo dynamiczna, chociaż nie powoduje oczopląsu. Typów przeciwników jest mnóstwo, część z nich ma cechy charakterystyczne jak chociażby wrażliwość na dany element i odporność na inny (wśród nich ogień, lód, trucizna, elektryczność). Nie zawsze działamy więc zupełnie bezmyślnie, niekiedy należy zaplanować przyszłą potyczkę z taktycznego punktu widzenia i na przykład zacząć od podejścia pod zasłoną niewidzialności do dużej grupki i otwarcia starcia obrotem z mieczem, które zetnie łby stojących w okolicy demonów. Właśnie, nie wspomniałem jeszcze o tym jaką szaloną jazdą jest   jeżeli chodzi o tak zwany „świat przedstawiony”. Są demony, które przedostały się przez bramy do innego wymiaru i aktualnie sieją postrach na przedmieściach czy słabiej zaludnionych obszarach, są niewidzialni ninja na usługach japońskich korporacji, jest Yakuza, są wielkie samurajskie zbroje łaknące naszej krwi, są ogromne mechy i drony plujące w naszą stronę ze wszystkich dział. Nie wspomnę już nawet o postaciach z wątku fabularnego, bo oni to już w ogóle odjechana zgraja. Szkoda trochę, że   zaoferowało nam fabułę będącą w zasadzie wyłącznie pretekstem do wystawienia paru przerysowanych postaci i okazją dla Lo Wanga do rzucenia kilku bardziej i mniej błyskotliwych żartów (zawsze jednak w charakterystycznym stylu, za to plus). Stracona okazja, bo tak dobra gra dużo by zyskała na porządnej historii.  nie jest szczególnie długim tytułem, przynajmniej jeżeli chcecie po prostu go „przelecieć” (chyba mi się udziela humor Lo Wanga). W takim wypadku szykujcie się na jakieś sześć godzin zabawy, plus parę kolejnych jeżeli skuszą Was misje poboczne. Dalej możecie bawić się z dziełem   ustawiając wyższe poziomy trudności i sięgając po możliwość zagrania ze znajomymi (sieciowy co-op). Normalnie można by się do tego przyczepić, ale pamiętajcie, że ta gra standardowo kosztuje połowę tego, co produkcje typu „triple-A”. Trochę brakuje mi jednak multiplayera player-vs-player. Produkcja ta aż prosi się o dodanie takiej możliwości, ale rozumiem że twórcy zostawiają sobie pole do popisu na przyszłość.  to świetny tytuł. Daje mnóstwo czystej frajdy, nie wymagając od gracza przesadnego zaangażowania, ani przesadnie drogiego sprzętu.  jest jak ekskluzywna tajska prostytutka, która oferuje bardzo dużo, nie oczekując za wiele w zamian. Piękna, soczysta rozwałka, podlana odlotowymi pukawkami, mozaikowym, przerysowanym klimatem i o wielkim sercu. Słaba fabuła i brak multiplayera nie zmieniają faktu, że bawiłem się przy produkcji   świetnie. +Czysty fun z zabawy mechaniką +Mnóstwo odlotowych broni +Piękna i dobrze zoptymalizowana +Niezły humor +Pomieszanie klimatów +Tryb kooperacji -Pomijalna fabuła -Drętwa mimika twarzy -Aż prosi się o tryb multiplayer PvP", "appid": "324800", "steamid": "profiles/76561198249211578", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "4", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1500984000.0}

{"text": "Рекомендую! Одна из лучших игр в своём жанре! Кто ещё до сих пор не прошёл, обязательно советую пройти!", "appid": "239140", "steamid": "profiles/76561198230287596", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "25", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1561723200.0}
{"text": "游戏刚开始一切都很正常，我原本以为就是一个平淡的甜作。枫怡真的是一个接近完美的女孩子，温婉大方，知书达理，声音也特别好听。但是剧情推进到中段，风格突变，变成了悬疑类型的游戏。我感觉制作方似乎有意营造出“这一切都是阴谋”的氛围。随着剧情的进一步深入，一切都水落石出。明明没有一个人是错的，可是结果却让人默然不语。 游戏的音乐水准较高，月海之音，枫霖之夜，枫花泪凝等曲子，都让我沉浸其中。建议大家购买音轨的DLC。可惜的是，明明曲子是好曲子，但是穿插的时机做的并不好，有些剧情的BGM很唐突或者不合适。游戏里有一些劣质音效，建议删除。有些出戏，而且让玩家感觉到一种廉价的感觉。 游戏人物的形象塑造得都还不错。恬静淡雅的枫怡，娇蛮可爱的枫茜，理性冷静的海音。还有幽默风趣的听涛，善解人意的庭雪和拥有“神之手”的主大夫。但是有两个人物，我觉得塑造得比较差。朱莉雅是其中之一。我觉得这个角色有点多余，删去这个角色对剧情并没有什么影响。而且朱莉雅在剧情中基本没有个人魅力可言，甚至有些时候还招人讨厌。郭恒逸——本作的男主角，让我非常痛恨。首先，设定上郭恒逸已经是枫怡的男朋友了，对海音的态度怎么还那么暧昧？这不就是一渣男吗？在没有回想起儿时的记忆之前，面对“可能自杀”的海音，不顾还在等待自己的枫茜，不顾自己有心肌炎，直接去海里救海音？真相大白之后，面对枫茜和海音，优柔寡断，贪恋两边的感情，不断伤害着两方，尤其是枫茜。我玩的时候真的很心疼。 剧情上大体没有漏洞，伏笔也都提及到了。但是问题在于，游戏前中期的伏笔埋得太多了，并且很明显，就差写着“这是伏笔”了。有些地方明明一笔带过就好了。伏笔的误导性也很强，就像我一开始说的，编剧有意往悬疑方向靠。游戏里面多次提及“雾之本镜”，我都没听说过，所以很懵逼。剧情后期还有“下一个镜主就要出现”什么的，完全不明所以。跟真恋没有关系。关于游戏结局，不论是枫茜的GE还是海音的GE，都是比较温馨的结局了。虽然我更喜欢枫茜，但是我却更倾向于海音线的GE。因为枫茜线的GE海音太可怜了，独自背负着两人的回忆，回到大海。抛去被听涛打死的恶搞BE，另外两个BE都显得有些草率了。枫茜线BE直接致郁，海音线BE纯属在搞笑，我甚至感觉制作组想不出来海音的BE该怎么安排了，所以搞了个“基语枫秋”，真的恶心到我了。 最后附上枫茜曾提到过的诗，雪莱的《一朵枯萎的紫罗兰》。我很喜欢。 The odor from the flower is gone, 这朵花的芬芳，已经消隐， Which like thy kisses breathed on me; 像你的吻对我吐露过的气息； The color from the flower is flown, 这朵花的颜色，已经凋陨， Which glowed of thee, and only thee! 它曾使我想起你独有的光辉！ A shriveled, lifeless, vacant form, 一个萎缩、僵死、空虚的形体， It lies on my abandoned breast, 搁置在我被冷落的胸襟， And mocks the heart, which yet is warm, 以它冷漠、寂静、无声的安息 With cold and silent rest. 嘲弄我依旧热烈的痴心。 I weep ---- my tears revive it not; 我哭泣，泪水不能使它复生； I sigh ---- it breathes no more on me; 我叹息，不再向我吐露气息； Its mute and uncomplaining lot 它静默无声无所怨忧的命运， Is such as mine should be. 正和我应得的那种一样无异。", "appid": "495990", "steamid": "profiles/76561198844100946", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "42", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1581681600.0}
{"text": "Играю в эту игру уже год, Лучшая MOBA на мой взгляд. Считаю, что это невероятно глубокая и сложная игра, которая предствляет собой отличное продолжение оригинальной DotA. Здесь имеется очень большое разнообразие героев, а также огромный выбор предметов, из которых можно составлять другие предметы (короче говоря - крафт). В самой игре присутсвует широкий выбор режим игр. Для развлечений (Ability Draft, All Random), так и нацеленные на серьезную игру (Captains Mode, Captains Draft). Также присутствует разделение самих игр на обычные и рейтинговые.  По мне игра получилась отличным продолжением оригинальной DotA с теми же героями, предметами, но с другим движком и реализацией. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well. Gameplay There are no game difficulty modes to choose from. Each puzzle has its own difficulty. {"text": "Когда грустно(((, можно хорошо запилить кого-то!!!)))", "appid": "381210", "steamid": "profiles/76561198384544698", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1593259200.0}
{"text": "Alright. Initially when I tried playing  , I ended up continually getting the good old, \"Could not write crash dump.\" error message and the game would not load. Now, I don't know what changed between then and now, but I thought I'd give it another go recently, and it fired up with no issues. I'm glad it did. Was it the greatest game ever? No. Did it ever lose sight of its fun factor? No. You kind of know the deal, right? You're B.J. Blazkowicz, renowned killer of Germans, called \"Terror Billy\" by his friends and enemies alike. In this one, the German war machine has defeated most of the United States. You awake after being in a coma from the events at the end of the previous game. Anya is pregnant, you're damaged beyond belief and are only being held together by a suit of armor....and off you go lol.  The first, oh I don't know....maybe third of the game is very serious. The Germans have found you and your companions and all hell breaks loose. Not literally. The supernatural is not present in this game. The rest of the game is pulpy, over the top, exaggerated and awesome. Every character pretty much becomes an extreme caricature of a certain type of person, intentionally, and to hilarious degrees.  I know a lot of people railed on about it being an \"SJW\" game, but I would just say that those first two words, social justice, are meaningful, and   did a nice job of bringing it home through satire and exaggerated late 60s early 70s era goodness. Is there meta? Yes. Is it applicable? More and more as the days wear on. I really enjoyed the story. It was fun, never lost sight of that, and yet successfully conveyed more than a few important messages as well. Despite all this, Wolfy 2 definitely also features a more introspective BJ, not that this stops the carnage, but at least he is aware of what he is doing and its impact, not to mention how his upbringing brought him to this place and time. I'm guessing you have already played one of the more recent entries to the series. If you haven't, you really should go back and do so before playing this one. Anyway, Wolfy 2 doesn't do much different. Dual wield is awesome though, and some of the limited use guns are especially useful. Your suit does give you some advantages as well, but the game does try to remind you that you aren't a god at times by having you play through a level in a wheelchair, for example. The game gives you the option to creep around, and that is fun to a degree, but really, I just went in guns blazing for the most part lol, and never batted an eye. I did like the Red Faction style environmental interplay in this one. I don't exactly recall if that was a feature of previous games, but it is hella cool. Basically, this is one giant ball of action. They try to make you think by placing commanders in every single section, who can and will call for backup until you find and kill them or successfully creep through the level with no alarms being raised (something I did not do once). Yeah, Wolfy2 looks and sounds great. Again, I don't note any real upgrades per se, but the set designs are pretty awesome, character models are on point, and even though there is some glitchiness, it almost always presents in amusing ways, such as dead enemy's faces melting into the ground, standing straight with one leg out and floating a bit, and so on. Some attention went into showing emotions on people's faces, and a lot of attention went into the voice acting, from the main characters to the random NPCs having on and off screen conversations. Much life was injected into this game and its world via both the audio tracks and graphics. It really served to create a living, breathing world, to smaller scale of course. Also, the soundtrack is as awesome as you would expect. Cutscenes were all movie quality btw, and the inclusion of an older Wolfenstein game is nice both on its own and as a reminder of what graphics used to be like. BJ has a hilarious quip the first time he decides to play it. Honestly, I don't get a lot of the criticism. Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus was fun from beginning to end in my opinion.", "appid": "612880", "steamid": "profiles/76561198044602606", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "29", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1586779200.0}

{"text": "굳이 평가가 필요한가 싶은 게임들이 있는데 그중 하나가 엔터더건전이 아닐까 싶습니다. 유명한 게임 스트리머들이 많이 플레이하였고 입소문은 이미 돌대로 돌아서 로그라이크를 좋아하지 않는 분들도 엥? 엔터더건전? 그거 어려운 게임 아니냐? 많이들 알고 계실 겁니다. 그래서 저도 2018 스팀 어워드 배지가 탐나지 않았다면 결코 이 게임의 평가를 적고 있지 않았을 거예요. 이왕 하게 된 것 로그라이크의 로자도 모르고 엔터더건전 챌린지모드로 못 깼지만 이 게임의 사랑하는 점을 몇 자 적어보고자 합니다. 저는 던그리드로 로그라이크를 시작했습니다. 같은 던전을 돌고 돌면서 마지막 보스를 향해가는 단순한 여정이 재미있었죠. 사람들은 부족한 콘텐츠를 지적했지만 저는 그런 단점이 실감 나지 않았습니다. 던그리드를 끝내고 비슷한 게임을 찾아서 엔터더건전을 실행시키기 전까지는 말이죠. 엔터더건전은 스탯 개념이 없습니다.  플레이하는 캐릭터가 강해지려면 좋은 총기와 아이템들을 얻어야 하죠. 제가 좋아하는 점 중 하나는 액티브 아이템을 제외하고 총기와 아이템의 소지 개수 제한이 없다는 것이었습니다. 건전에는 수많은 총기와 아이템들이 있어서 게임을 하는 도중에도 몇 번이고 나무위키를 확인해야 하죠. 이 많은 총기와 아이템들을 얻으면 얻는 대로 모두 가져갈 수 있다니! 어떤 게임을 하든 주울 수 있는 것들은 모두 주워서 상점에 팔아야 직성이 풀리는 저 같은 사람들에게는 너무나 편ㅡ안 그 자체였던 것입니다.  총기와 아이템들의 개성이 뚜렷해서 소지하는 것들이 늘어날수록 다양한 플레이가 가능합니다. 저격수처럼 벽 뒤에 숨어 하나씩 제거하거나, 잠시 무적이 되어서 적진 가운데로 들어가서 무쌍, 남김없이 불태워버리는 방화범 플레이도 가능하죠. 매번 제로에서 시작해서 다른 총과 아이템을 얻으면서 마지막까지 살아남기 위해 플레이 스타일을 계획하고 해낸다는 즐거움이 있습니다. (물론 쏘고 피한다는 기본 틀은 변하지 않습니다.) 또 크게 달라지는 것은 없지만 그래도 매번 위치가 달라지는 던전들, 대화를 통해 알려지는 작은 스토리들은 신선함을 오래 유지하게 해줍니다. 열심히 던전을 돌고 손에 들고 온 헤게모니 크레딧으로 아이템을 하나둘씩 해금하는 것은 결코 빠질 수 없는 즐거움이고, 이번에 업데이트된 시너지효과는 소소한 재미와 경우에 따라서는 강력한 힘이 되어주죠. 그리고 비밀방과 가끔 등장하는 괴상한 상자나 NPC들이 게임이 너무 처지지 않게 도와줍니다. 아트와 음악도 참 감각적이에요. 엔딩크레딧이 올라가면서 나오는 음악은 아직도 가끔씩 듣고 있습니다. 그리고 제가 엔터더건전에서 가장 사랑하는 점은 도전정신을 고취시킨다는 점입니다. ‘도전정신 고취’라니 이거 무슨 사장님이 직원들에게 뭔가 있어 보이는 말 하고 싶은데 딱히 생각은 안날 때 나 때는 말이야~ 하면서 하는 말 아닌가 싶은데요. 아마도 이 부분은 컨트롤 만렙분들에게는 해당되지 않을 겁니다. 저 같은 손고자들은 이런 게임을 만나면 2가지로 나누어져요. 포기하거나 계속 도전하거나. 보통 1층을 돌고 할만한데? 하면서 2층에 가서 철로 만든 뚱땡이 같은 것에게 피가 쭉 깎이고 울면서 2층보스한테 얻어맞다가 아니 이게 뭐야 하다가 뭐긴 뭐야 게임 오버란다 하게 됩니다. 그렇게 몇 번을 더 도전하다가 나하고는 안 맞는다고, 어렵다고 생각되어 라이브러리에서 실행되지 않은 채 먼지만 쌓이게 되죠. 그래도 됩니다. 그냥 게임일 뿐이니까요.  그런데 저처럼 어떻게든 막보스까지 가고 싶다는 생각에 몇십 번, 몇백 번 도전하는 분들 계실 거예요. 중간에 나 정말 게임 못 하는구나 절망을 하면서도 몇십 번의 도전 끝에 저층 보스에게 한대도 안 맞고 클리어가 가능해지는 자신을 보고 놀라면서 이렇게 조금씩 컨트롤이 나아지면 나도 드래곤 잡을 수 있겠지. 그러다가 정말로 드래곤을 잡고 해냈다! 소리지르고, 이제 짐에게는 드래곤 따위는 아무것도 아니니라 캐릭터 과거를 해금해야겠노라 생각하면서 한발 더 나아간 목표들을 세우고 또 몇십 번, 몇백 번의 도전, 그리고 결국 목표달성! 머릿속에서는 성취감으로 도파민이 춤을 춥니다. 도전-절망-인내-성장-성취 이런 드라마틱한 경험을 어디서 이렇게 짧은 시간 내에 여러 번 얻을 수 있을까요.  인생은 짧다고 하지만 무언가를 성취해내기에는 길게 느껴집니다. 외국어도, 시험도, 인간관계도 뭐든 좋은 결과를 내려면 노력은 물론이고 흘러가는 시간도 견뎌내야 하죠. 목표를 이루기 위해 노력하지만 때때로 절망이 찾아오고 쉽게 결과가 나오지 않기에 자신이 진짜 성장하고 있는지 의심하기 쉬워집니다. 실패했다면 다시 일어나기 위해 또 노력해야 해요. 그리고 재도전하려면 많은 위험부담을 안고 시작해야 하죠.   다른 스토리형 게임에 비해 빈약하다면 빈약한 스토리를 가지고, 결국은 반복의 반복일 뿐인 이 단순한 게임으로 저는 인생의 예행연습을 몇백 번 반복한 듯한 기분이 듭니다. 쉽게 단념하는 것을 쿨하게 여겼던 저는 이 게임을 하면서 쉽게 포기하지 않는 것이 얼마나 재밌고 의미 있는 일인가 새삼 느끼게 되었습니다. 인생에서 그런 것을 배우려면 정말 비싼 값을 치러야 한다고 생각해요. 물론 현생에서 부딪치며 직접 피부로 겪을 수 있으면 더 좋죠. 그 교훈은 뼈에 박혀서 절대 잊혀 지지 않을 테니까요. 하지만 세일해서 8000원에 약 300시간 정도만 투자하여 도전의 소중함을 알았다는 것, 처음에는 불가능해 보였을지라도 포기하지 않으면 100퍼센트가 아니더라도 자신이 납득할 수 있는 결과를 이루어 낼 수 있다는 것을 몇백 번 반복하여 뇌 속에 집어넣은 저는 인생을 보는 시각이 조금 더 넓어진 것 같습니다. 그리고 몇백 번의 도전과 반복은 단순히 저의 인내심으로 이루어진 것이 아니라 엔터더건전이 요행 없이 충실하게 만들어진 게임이라서 가능했다고 생각합니다. 손고자분들 중에 도전, 인내 같은 것들이 좋은 것이라고 알고는 있지만 적지 않은 실패와 안주함으로 단어의 의미가 와닿지 않고 퇴색되어버린 분들, 그런 분들께 이 게임을 추천 드리고 싶습니다.", "appid": "311690", "steamid": "profiles/76561198124329407", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "45", "votes_funny": "2", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1542974400.0}

Проводя в ведьмаке по 12 часов в день, я уже не мог воспринимать другие игры и даже забыл чем обычно занимался в свободное время. Можно бесконечно подбирать хорошие слова, для охарактеризации ведьмака, пока они просто не закончатся. Разработчики просто красавцы, начинаешь понимать при первом прохождении игры, насколько же тут много вложено труда, как сильно были вдохновлены все люди, учавствовавшие в ее создании. Проще подговорить купить друга эту игру и дать ему по своей воле испытать те же чувства, чем поделится с ним гаммой эмоций которые испытываешь. Здесь есть всё, на любой вкус и цвет. Сами разработчики будто бы создали игру от лица всего гейм-коммьюнити, мне кажется они смогли удовлетворить потребности и категоричность абсолютно каждого поигравшего. А эти DLC! О госпади, они шедевральны. Это наглядный пример того, когда разработчикам не насрать на игроков и они делают шедевр еще шедевральнее чем изначальный шедевр. Да за такие DLC можно и человека любимого убить [FBR. Это просто шутка, а не скрытый мотив, так что сасатт]. В отличии от остальных игр, где тебе могут предоставить шапочку на персонажа за 200 рублей или предложить купить отдельно миссии, чтобы продолжать играть, в DLC к ведьмаку просто полнейшая доступность всего, что только душе угодно, с глубокой детализацией, взаимодействием, вариацией, персонажами, сюжетом и атмосферой. Но есть и минусы в шедевральности ведьмача. Я прошел игру два раза, оббежал все вопросики, выполнил все квесты, завершил все ачивки и меня вроде бы уже не должно ничего держать в этой игре, но вот suка чувство такое странное внутри. Хочется еще. Пусть даже высосанное из пальца или высранное из жопы. Я хочу больше историй про приключения ведьмака Геральта из мать вашу Ривии и остальных персонажей. Мне их мало. Мне их не хватает. Я готов провести с ними всю свою жизнь, лишь бы это не заканчивалось. Теперь меня терзает изнутри желание стереть память и просто заново переиграть весь тайтл. Поэтому мне и плохо, потому что я знаю, что так сделать не получится. Да и если я решу перепройти его через годика 2, то вряд ли для меня всё будет так же красочно, потому что в данной игре любой пройденный квест, любое имя персонажа пусть даже и живущего у черта на куличиках запоминается и осядает в памяти. Спросит кто-то. -А разве есть повод этого не делать после всего мною описанного? Отвечу я. В общем, шедевр - он и в африке шедевр. В конце концов должна же игро-индустрия предоставить нам что-нибудь такого же уровня качества, как ведьмак. В любом случае ждем следующих игр от поляков и надеемся,что они смогут переплюнуть ведьмака и занять главенстующее место в мире игр. The Talos Principle — умная и, в каком-то смысле, хардкорная игра. В ней все построено на логике и внимательности. Она разнообразна и богата идеями, которые редко увидишь в других играх. It´s basically a perfect RPG, where to be good at something, you need to train hard. Really beautiful landscapes and graphics, with great sound effects and combat mechanics. The worl really feels like it is alive. The cons are, of course, the bugs (which I actually haven´t experience that much) such as stuck NPCs moonwalking, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ stairs and a bit of performance issues (I get around 60FPS on woods and roads, and 45FPS at towns), but nothing that makes the game unplayable. Plus the saving system is one of the worst actually. To save the game, you need to sleep, complete certain quests or, to save anywhere you want, you´ll need a special potion which is very expensive. This does not ruins the game, but it is really a pain in the *** when you need to actually leave the game, but can´t because there are no sleeping bed, completed quest or potion. {"text": "остаётся один после смерти своей матери, которая любила рисовать. Правда, ни одно из своих произведений она так и не довела до конца. Перед тем как отправиться в приют,   выбрал из всех её работ холст с незаконченным лебедем. Однажды мальчик проснулся посреди ночи и увидел, что лебедь исчез с картины. Следы птицы уходили в приоткрытую дверцу, которой раньше не было, поэтому наш герой \"вооружился\" серебряной кисточкой матери и отправился вглубь неизведанного на поиски лебедя.    Начинается всё с полностью белой локации, где ничего не видно из-за отсутствия цветов и теней, но у нас есть черная краска, разбрасывая которую, мы можем изучать окружение и прокладывать себе путь дальше. Позже чёрная краска сменяется водой, с помощью которой мы заставляем расти вьюнки, а уже они позволяют нам взбираться по их поверхности, преодолевая, например, стены. На этом геймплей не перестаёт удивлять, ведь дальше нам предоставляется возможность делать объёмные фигуры, что служат либо частью сооружения, либо обычным прямоугольным предметом, которым можно ещё и кидаться. Узнавать о сюжете мы сможем по найденным буквам на стенах, таящих в себе целую страницу текста. Также в игре можно собирать воздушные шары, позволяющие в меню открывать полезные функции, которые не обязательны для прохождения, но помогут его облегчить  .  Там, где нужно было разбрасывать повсюду чёрную краску, я почувствовала себя почти художником, потому как окружение приобретало сюрреалистичный вид, созданный именно мной, а не кем-то ещё. Во многом продукт минималистичен донельзя, хотя некоторые локации удивляли своим контрастом в противопоставление тому, что мы видим в начале. В целом, вся игра, как было сказано, это практически пустое полотно, а наша задача — изучить его, найти скрытые послания, наполняя и обогащая всё вокруг. Музыка не нагнетает атмосферу, не вызывает негативных эмоций. Эмбиент, в совокупности с геймплеем, даёт возможность расслабиться и на время позабыть о всех своих делах. По моему мнению, это хорошее и грамотное дополнение к путешествию. 1.  2.  3.  4.  1.  2.  3.", "appid": "1206430", "steamid": "profiles/76561198139103521", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "68", "votes_funny": "3", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1600171200.0}

{"text": "As I get older I tend to enjoy casual games more than I used to, so personally I don't mind this trend of mobile games or ports coming to steam at low prices. The developer also was smart enough to have the game run at 60fps natively, so the developer did not mistep there as far as im concerned. The menu options are also sufficient for a game like this. The most impressive part of this game is that there seems to be no screen tearing even at high speeds which is also a plus for a game like this. My only complaints would be that there is only one song in the game, and it can get tiring listening to it. {"text": "Best hat wearing simulator 0BC-3333", "appid": "440", "steamid": "profiles/76561198079557441", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1427025600.0}
{"text": "Youp' On se retrouve pour ce nouveau F2P disponible aussi sur Steam. On est dans un période où le genre Shooters et/où MOBA n'innove plus. On ne crée plus de communautés, on divise celles existantes ce qui ne fait plus de jeux mondialement reconnus où possédant une communauté exponentielle. Dans cette optique je ne nourrissais aucun espoir pour ce jeu. Je voulais le test, c'est tout. Bah croyez-le où pas, je suis surpris et on y passe relativement du bon temps, pas mal de détente et c'est très agréable avec des amis ! On se retrouve ici sur du genre  Je vais fortement résumer le format : deux équipes de 5 champions ( avec chacun leurs compétences et utilité ) progressent sur une map avec plusieurs points de contrôles à posséder et défendre. Ces points ( ainsi que le kill ) donnent de la puissance à une sorte de Titan allié, qui quand il est feed, va attaquer celui adverse, et on l'accompagne dans cet assaut. La première équipe à renverser le Titan ennemi l'emporte. Alors on pourrait se dire \"encore un énième Shooter, encore un MOBA, on copie Overwatch qui askip à copié Paladin qui s'est fait copier par Gigantic, blahblahblah..\". N’empêche qu'objectivement, ce système de Titans et contrôle de points ainsi que recherche de puissance pour le feed est foutrement efficace, tiens les parties en haleine et ne lasse pas. On rajoute à ça que le contrôle des points se fait avec des invocation de Gardiens aux multiples compétences pour les défendre et aider en TF, et on comprends qu'outre ses allures de Shooters, la tactique et la Stratégie ont bien plus à offrir que le skill individuel. Côté champions, une présence d'une Trinité => Support / Tank / DPS mais moins prononcée que sur d'autres jeux du genre. Le healing est optionnel puisque la santé se régénère seule avec le temps, avec des orbes sur la map ou avec les compétences des gardiens que l'ont peut invoquer. Le tanking par contre offre un réel avantage sur les Teamfights, et certaines compétences de Support comme le Silence ou Stun ne restent pas négligeables. On à par contre un petit déséquilibre encore avec des champions vraiment peu utiles, et une prédominante de picks se forme déjà, avec des champions assez efficaces pour ce jeu comparés à d'autres. Ce qui se passe en match : c'est nerveux. Très nerveux. Les champions sont assez mobiles, ont à une jauge d'endurance qui permet des sprints, des jumps et des esquives. Les TFs sont donc assez excitants et il faut vraiment suivre, être réactif et ne pas perdre la vue de son champion tout en surveillant sa barre de PVs et d'endurance. Pas de mana, juste du cooldown, et la vie se régénère hors-combat. Chaque mort rend plus puissant le Titan adverse, et l'on pèse donc ses actes, ont réfléchit ( mais très vite ) et on ne fait pas n'importe quoi. Le teamplay et la stratégie ont un impact réellement décisif sur ce jeu, et vu les assassins disponibles dans la sélection, il ne vaut mieux pas tenter les actions individuelles sous peine de feed. Je finirais par dire que sur nos 4 compétences en jeu, les upgrade au fur et à mesure de la partie nous propose de les orienter. Chaque compétence à plusieurs développements possibles et cible plusieurs gameplays et situations. On peut donc faire prendre des tournures très intéressantes et personnalisée pour nos héros, selon notre gameplay, nos envies, la situation de la partie, notre équipe... Un bon plus ! Savoir maîtriser un personnage et l'évolution de ses compétences aide fortement en jeu. Le jeu est neuf et on ne lui en voudra pas de ne présenter qu'un mode de jeu accompagné de 3 maps et une quinzaine de champions. Malgrès ces chiffres peu impressionnants, on ne s'ennuie pas et le fun du jeu nous fait vite oublier ses maigres apparences. Le leveling du compte, des maîtrises des champions ainsi que l'achat de tout les champions et leur skins devraient largement occuper d'ici les prochaines updates. F2P. Tout est accessible gratuitement et on à une petite boutique où l'on peut acheter des devises avec de l'argent réel pour buy des champions et skins. Mais ce n'est que de P2F. Tout les champions et tout les skins se prennent avec la monnaie du jeu amassée en partie. Gros coup de cœur. On peut se demander en voyant les screens si ce style peut plaire en jeu, et moi même ai douté. Mais c'est très beau et agréable, et ne casse réellement pas la tête à force d'y jouer. C'est très coloré, lumineux, et assez beau en map et char design, même si l'on a que peu de temps pour visiter. Cette hyper luminosité et colorimétrie est réellement magnifique et ne lasse pas. L'interface, même si je l'ai déjà vue dans d'autres jeux, est très minimaliste, simple et épurée. Elle reste néanmoins pratique et agréable, on ne demande pas plus. Pour résumer, on peut penser que c'est une énième entrée dans le genre, mais ce petit système de Titans et invocation pour contrôler la map ouvre une dimension stratégique et tactique. La nervosité et mobilité sera au service de la stratégie, et pas du skill individuel ou d'un éventuel chasing du KDA. Le jeu est neuf et ne présente encore que peu de contenu, mais retiens néanmoins l'intérêt. Graphiquement c'est très agréable et heureusement, car sinon je l'aurais déconseillé. Pour ce qui est du négatif : - Peu de contenu : 1 mode de jeu, 3 maps et une quinzaine de champions - Des champions qui sont trop faibles pour certains, une Tier List est effective - Pas de remplacement d'un joueur qui quitte la game ( et ça c'est freelose ) - Tristesse pour ceux qui n'ont pas 6G de RAM, ils ne peuvent pas jouer Au final, c'est une agréable surprise et je le recommande complètement, pour tout public. C'est un F2P digne du DL et d'une bibliothèque de jeu, à jouer avec amis pour une expérience vraiment sympa.", "appid": "327690", "steamid": "profiles/76561198019558795", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "60", "votes_funny": "1", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1500811200.0}

{"text": "Anfangs war ich skeptisch was dieses Spiel anging, doch ich wurde angenehm überrascht. Endlich schafft es mal ein Spiel die Kernelemente der Zombieapokalypse hervorzuholen und nicht mit wildem Geballere, wie in so manchen anderen Spielen, untergehen zu lassen. Das Hauptaugenmerk des Spiels liegt nähmlich im Ausbau und der Versorgung seiner eigenen \"Festung\".  Diese wird von Überlebenden verteidigt. Jeder Überlebende kann gespielt werden und hat eigene Merkmale, die positive, wie auch negative Auswirkungen haben. Auch kann man seine Schützlinge im späteren Spiel auf spezifische Waffen festlegen und skillen. Die \"Festung\" gilt es zu befestigen und zu verteidigen. Wird die Basis zu klein, oder gehen einem die Vorräte in der derzeitigen Stadt aus, wird mann gezwungen lange Versorgungsfahrten in Kauf zu nehmen, oder in eine andere Stadt umzuziehen. Auch muss man entscheiden welche Aufgaben man machen will, oder welche nicht. Leider hat das Spiel aber auch ein Paar nicht so schöne Seiten. So ist der Kampf gegen mehrere Zombies recht unübersichtlich und man greift oft willkürlich einen Feind an, als sich taktisch einen auszusuchen. Auch bleiben Leichen oft in der Luft schweben, oder Autos verhaken sich in Zäunen, welche dann dort wurzeln schlagen, da sie nicht mehr zu lösen sind. Auch hat man das Gefühl nie etwas wirklich wertvolles oder seltenes zu finden. Alles hat man irgentwie irgentwo schonmal gefunden. Im großen Ganzen hat das Spiel aber viel richtig gemacht. Überlebende wachsen einen ans Herz und das Überleben spielt eine zentrale Rolle. Ich empfehle jedem \"realistic\" Zombie-Fan dieses Spiel und hoffe auf gute Erweiterungen seitens der Entwickler, wenn nicht eine Fortsetzung.", "appid": "241540", "steamid": "profiles/76561198022146783", "voted_up": true, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1386331200.0}

{"text": "Dans cette enquête (simulateur de marche narratif et interactif), vous êtes une jeune femme (Nicole Wilson) et vous héritez d'un hôtel perdu dans la montagne qui appartenait à vos parents. Une dizaine d'années plus tôt, une certaine Rachel Foster, 16 ans, attardée pour les uns, dyslexique pour les autres, et enceinte, s'est suicidée après une liaison avec votre père. C'est dans ce contexte charmant que vous arrivez à l'hôtel dans lequel une tempête de neige (hasard) vous condamne à rester. Et c'est parti pour fouilles et déambulations dans les couloirs, les chambres, les caves, greniers et bureaux. Votre enquête est très progressive avec l'aide de votre téléphone et d'un plan complet de l'hôtel présentant un cartouche consacré à votre objectif immédiat. \"The suicide of Rachel Foster\" n'est pas le jeu du siècle mais l'on passe un bon moment à mener cette quête. {"text": "OutDrive is a retro style driving game which has you driving at high speeds to keep 'girl' alive and if you drop below a certain speed for too long it's game over and the aim in the game is too drive for as long as possible without her dying or having the car overheat too much which kills her. The positives in this game are as follows, you get a back story to why you are driving and the graphics are pretty good and the level design is rather attractive. Also there is a global leader board so you can what position you hold out of all the other players but the chances of getting to number one are low because the person in number one has a score of 225+ hours which is pretty crazy and the amount of determination that person had to leave the computer on and play for 200+ hours is besides me. This game does have quite a few drawbacks and the main one is that it is very repetitive as you are driving through the same level over and over. Every so often a helicopter will fly by and shoot pieces of the ground witch can throw you off course but they become very easy to avoid, and after a short time of shooting the helicopter while just explode for no reason. Another downfall of the game is that it remains the same difficulty throughout the entire game so once you get a hand of the controls it's quite easy to drive for a long time. (Well easy until your hand starts to cramp up) Another feature I found difficult was drifting, the purpose of it is to get round corners without losing too much speed but every time i attempted it I would just spin out of control and slam into a wall. {"text": "Скрепя сердце ставлю диз. Нет, не подумайте - игра мне очень понравилась, просто хочу дать капкому понять, что новый формат хуже старого, и продолжать в нем не стоит. По фактам. Если вы большой фанат РЕ, то игра очень стоящая. Хоть она и проходится довольно быстро, но всё это время в игре что-то активно происходит, какой-то экшон, киношность и катсцены, поэтому эти 6-8 часов приносят массу эмоций.  Иии...это и есть основная проблема игры. Капкомы решили сделать эту часть более зрелищной и киношной, забив на такие важные и любимые фанами вещи, как саспенс и атмосфера. Возможно, вы скажете, что это не взаимоисключающие вещи, и игра вполне может быть одновременно астмосферносаспенсовой и киношной - и будете правы. Но капком почему-то решили сосредоточиться только на втором аспекте. По сути, игра была бы идеальна, будь в ней всего пара изменений - увеличенные раза в 3 локации и хотя бы пара головоломок на игру. Ну и пара доп.локаций бы не помешала. В текущем виде локации супер компактные. Причем не \"недоделанные\" или \"сырые\", а именно компактные, как будто они целенаправленно старались сделать игру как можно более короткой. Ну и напоследок : новый немезис пиздат, но из-за темпа игры не успеваешь его толком испугаться, как и проникнуться персонажами. Отсылочки в оригинальной ре3 приятные, хоть и не все раскрываются ( судьбу деда закрывшегося в кузове в ремастере мы так и не узнаем ). {"text": "The game is better than Radical Roach (by the same dev). That's not saying much though. DO NOT. I repeat DO NOT buy this at any price above 50 cent. You'll find free flash games better than this. The reason you would pay anything above zero is because at the very least it drop trading cards and there is a mild amusement factor thrown in. Pros: -Theme. Okay, I like the zombie cows and old farmer as the protagonist. Cons: -Hit box. About the worst thing in the game. It is so inconsistent. You can be hitting cows in the head at one moment and in the next watch bullets zip through like ghosts. This is especially evident when old farmer shooting from the barn window as zombie cows dance around. There's been many times when I get hit by a cow just right after a shot just whiz past. Oh yeah, of course it's a one hit kill. -Reload speed. You are given a reload button but cannot reload as fast as your thumb pressing on the dang thing. If that's by design it's a really poor choice for a shooter that depends on it. As level progress cows come up faster & faster and in greater numbers. When you have to manage between shooting, reload, inventory purchase, and support from above and you come up blank do to reload response isn't there, it's really frustrating. (FYI, I'm using a 360 controller) -Spawning at the start of level. This is old school cheap method of making a game longer than it really is. -Repetition. I have to mention this even though it is expected of this type of game. It's the very least of concern (see above). Shooters require tight controls and mechanics which this game does not have, making it not only challenging but frustrating. I simply cannot recommend it. Only get this is it's a bundle filler or given free.", "appid": "297020", "steamid": "profiles/76561197985100593", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "2", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1425211200.0}
{"text": "I want to preface this by stating that this is a must-have for anyone playing the game. The ability to taxiderm your hunts and show them to your friends is simply essential. However, there are a few minor issues that added together made me more irritated at them than excited to have this feature.  - First off, the lodge is designed in an extremely specific way and you have no ability to change it. Obviously you can choose what animals go one what preset areas, but you have no choice deciding what those areas are. For example, there are plaques on the wall and on tables that can only fit extra small animals like fowl and rabbits. If you don't happen to hunt those animals or care about mounting them, it means that an entire area of usable space is now taken up by slots you aren't interested in. I tend to hunt the big game, and it's pretty irritating that floor space that could easily fit a large stand is taking up by a rabbit stand or a goose stand, or enough wall space for several large animals is dedicated to small ones. I feel like this could be easily fixed by adding in an option to swap what is in that area. For example, on the ground just as some platforms can be rotated, have an option to swap them out to larger/smaller ones depending on if there is enough space. The same goes for the ones on the walls. - The game is EXTREMELY picky about what animals can go where. For example, the small platform can fit a warthog or a musk deer, but not a springbok or any other small antelopes, despite the fact that they seem to be the perfect size for them. Wildebeest only fit on large platforms and plaques, despite the fact that they seem like they would fit on the mediums. While you can put a smaller animal like a rabbit on a much bigger sized platform, you cannot put a big animal on a little one. While that tends to make sense (a buffalo cannot sit on a coffee table), there were countless times where I wanted a certain animal on a certain platform and the game wouldn't allow it for seemingly no reason.  I think a more 'loose' placement of animals on plaques/platforms would be greatly appreciated and would give a lot more creativity and freedom to how you design the lodge. - The Shoulder mounts....aren't shoulder mounts. For those who are not familiar with hunting, when you are taxiderming an animal to go on the wall, you mount it from the very start of the shoulders forwards. In game however, they start at the neck or even at the back of the head forwards. As a result, a lot of the animals look really weird when you put them on the wall mounts. The cattle and larger antelope in particular look really goofy when it's just a head resting on a gigantic plaque with tons of unused space. I feel like a change here would probably be easier than the other suggestions and also more immediately needed, since there are so few spots to put large animals on the ground and it looks so goofy to put them on the wall. - Following the previous, there simply aren't enough spaces to put big animals on the ground, especially because of what might be the biggest problem with the lodge. It is very 'specifically' designed. There are several predetermined rooms with their own names and functions (Bedroom, Dining Room, etc) which again reduces not only creativity but more importantly space. It was quite frustrating to not have the space to put an animal you want in your hunting lodge because there is so much furniture everywhere. Again, I wish there could be an option to replace furniture with a stand (or multiple smaller stands) for animals. Lastly, while this isn't the most important thing, I can't help but feel this should have been free with the game. Charging people extra for what seems like a standard game-play feature just doesn't feel right. I don't mind too much because this really was an exciting feature but all these other qualms together add up to it feeling really disapointing. If all the above mentioned things were changed (Or even just one or two) I would probably change my review to positive but I worry that they won't be taking suggestions/criticisms since it seems to be a specific manor; they strongly imply that there will be other lodges in the future. From that regard, I do have a suggestion for the future to make this more enjoyable; In the future make a sort of 'blank canvas' hunting lodge, which could start out with a single room and you could pay in-game cash to expand it, choosing the size of a connecting room, and then individually choosing what you want in that room. So you could make a new empty room, and in preset 'grids' place the specific platforms you want, so you could have a room filled with large stands, or mix and matched, or etc.  I get the idea of having a neatly designed 'set peice' lodge, but since it seems to have come at the expense of the actual feature of taxiderming your hunts I would rather have had larger, 'blank' rooms to design as the player sees fits.", "appid": "1052690", "steamid": "profiles/76561198074479203", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "152", "votes_funny": "8", "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1554984000.0}

{"text": "Initially I couldn't even start the game, I tried many of the fixes that had been posted and had no luck, finally I found one that works and so I sat down to play. After finally getting the game to work, seriously paradox this launch was shoddy as hell, I can give you my first impressions. (For reference I played at a tribe in \"Britain\") ---------------------------------------- Events: Events that happen seem pretty lacklustre, from what I've seen it feels like there's only around 5 - 10 and all that changes is the character names, they certainly don't seem to really have any real effect on the game or your characters, a bit of loyalty change here or there etc and not much else. ---------------------------------------- Economy: The economy needs some balancing, getting enough Oratory power to do anything takes forever as too many things require it, whereas from my experience you'll be sitting on a pile of Religious & Military power that only functions to exist when your omen ticks off for religious power (or a random stability drop happens) or as a side tech tree in terms of the military power, which I've seen possibly be relevant in one event so far which required like 25 out of the 1000 I had. The trading system with its surpluses etc is an interesting idea, but if you play the game as presumably intended and take over others peoples lands your access to anything to import will be screwed. ---------------------------------------- Research: The research system is more of a Stellaris one in this game (or MOO2 if you like), which is fine, the trouble being that if you do invest in research like I did (currently about 100 years ahead with no trouble at all) all the tech (small incremental buffs to things) is just going to fly by as you most likely won't be getting enough Culture points to purchase it all and each new tech level hides the previous options you unlocked only to be revealed when you clear one of the newer ones away.  I also can't help but feel like you should maybe be able to purchase Military tech with military power visa versa. Research has a big impact on the game, but you won't feel like it does as you're not really unlocking anything new, just buffing already existing things. ---------------------------------------- Characters: The characters in the game don't have much of a personality, sometimes their little perks do effect events, the ultra common event where a petitioner appears at court worrying that someone was going to kill her mysteriously and you can either comfort her or take the money she wants to leave you in her will got a third event because my character had the Lunacy perk, a third option that said \"Kill her in a Mysterious way\" which was funny, but so far the only example I've seen of this kind of thing. Aside from that, there's no real way to interact with your characters, 90% of the options will be greyed out for some stupid reason, why can't I imprison etc people when I want for a bit of tyranny? (Presumably because it would break the rebellion mechanics) and they merely sit there as stat boxes, you can't influence their actions like in CK2 and your children also can't be guided into a role you might want filling from an heir, infact I often forgot I even had children because nothing bad even happens when someone not of my family inherits the throne/chiefdom etc anyway apart from one person being a bit pissy for a bit. Christ even Stellaris leaders had more personality than this. ---------------------------------------- Summary: I'm still enjoying the game so far but I don't know why, as I can see its flaws and it's no where near as good as it should be, you get the honest feeling that the filler that made other Paradox games like CK2 great (A wide array of events that interact with the world) has been cut for DLC down the road, because I Refuse to believe Paradox hasn't learnt their lesson on what works by now and that the meme(?) of Paradox games being empty on content at launch seems to be entirely true. The game is broken, bland and barren. Wait till they add more content and fix all the game breaking bugs and for the love of god when the game is fixed don't reward them for this behaviour and don't buy more content until the vanilla base game has been fleshed out till it feels like a full game. {"text": "If you waded through the atrocious gameplay of Rescue Lucy and House 23 Escape DLC #1, you probably know that this DLC is not going to be good. Yet in the course of the eight days it took to release this after House 23 Escape DLC #1, even more problems somehow slithered into this add-on. It's rather amazing to see this game/series/whatever you might call it continue to roll downhill with no signs of stopping. Hopefully this is the last DLC they make, though I'm not getting my hopes up. House Escape DLC #2 (but not House 23 for whatever reason) is free, just like DLC #1. It's a small blessing to not cost anything, and it's another piece of the game to add to Rescue Lucy's ridiculously short length. Not that I get why it's part of Rescue Lucy, because once again, this has nothing to do with the dog or the girl. It also has nothing to do with DLC #1. Similar play-styles are there, but there are actually some odd changes as well. In Rescue Lucy, you had five seconds to kill monsters before they killed you. You had to use a different item for each monster. The five seconds part was an awful decision, but using the different items was a legitimately good choice. This DLC is where the developer finally figured out that the timer should be done away with. However, the unique items to kill monsters were taken out as well. Instead, you have a gun of all things, and you pick up some easily-found bullets to shoot whatever you find. There are only two exceptions to this, and it is not explained as to why you can't shoot those monsters too. Frankly, having a gun as a constant weapon in a point-and-click puzzle game is a poor choice. I am sure it could be used well some way or another, but not here. All the developer did was take a good and bad idea and switch them around, leaving us back at square one. The items zoom in each time you pick them up, but they have higher resolutions this time. Most of them are easy to identify, and thank everything for that, because they STILL don't have labels. The items menu works fine for combining items, and choosing to use them is as clunky as ever. This is especially bad with the number of keys you get. I swear that a good fourth of my gameplay in this DLC was swapping items around, with unlabeled keys being the biggest offenders. Most of the logic here is far more straightforward than in Rescue Lucy and DLC #1. There were only a few parts that stood out as bewildering to me, and they were still easy to figure out due to process of elimination. There has also been some sort of revelation between DLCs about needing to show what can be picked up and interacted with, for the mouse changes upon going over such locations. Hallelujah. As such, this DLC probably took less time for me than either the main game or its sibling DLC. Even so, it felt like it was about the same length, which means \"not long at all.\" So I have mentioned some problems, but there are two that are far more offensive than what's already been listed. One is that there is a sliding tile puzzle. This is the first interactive game-puzzle-thing to be seen in this \"series\" and I applaud the developer for trying to add something new in. Then I boo and throw tomatoes because this puzzle is so poorly designed. Why? Because it isn't on its own separate plane. It overlaps the room you're in, and if you click where the door is that takes you back a room, you go there. Which means the puzzle resets. And you get to do it ALL. OVER. AGAIN. This happened TWICE to me despite me taking as great of care as I could to not click that door, and needless to say, I was boiling at the end of it. The other really obnoxious issue is the conclusion of the \"story.\" I use quotes because there is no story to start out. At the end, you figure out what your goal was. And boy, is it a stupid goal. I won't spoil it in case you want to see the idiocy yourself, but get ready for out-of-place graphics, bad voice acting, and a stupid victory screen. On the bright side, since there's only two places with words in the whole game, there's no bad translations to read. Hey, avoiding written storytelling means there's less to screw up, so that makes this a masterful plan! At this point, I'm starting to think the DLCs are being produced to try and convince us that Rescue Lucy is not a bad game. With the DLCs being this bad, surely it must look good in comparison! Well, if that was the plan, it failed, because Rescue Lucy is still awful. DLC #1 is worse. DLC #2 is even worse. The amount of failure keeps increasing, and I am concerned that if a DLC #3 is released, it will be so bad that it will cause the internet to explode. Even if said third DLC were to be free, I would not want to be \"graced\" by its presence. Whether it does or not, avoid House Escape DLC #2 unless you really want to subject yourself to its horribleness.", "appid": "498811", "steamid": "profiles/76561198040208524", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "15", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1469188800.0}

{"text": "Necronator: Dead Wrong is an interesting premise let down by being released too early. The RPG card battler genre fused with an autobattler is a fun mix, but there isn’t enough content to justify the game’s price. Everything is quite repetitive and the AI eventually devolves into a spam fest instead of using tactics.   Before a run is started, the player is able to choose from the two currently available  commanders which each focus on a different theme. The first general is an undead knight that focuses on buffing units in her hand until even the weakest unit becomes a formidable opponent. The second commander is an undead puppet master who changes the game up a bit by having cards that are essentially towers. This in turn makes Necronator feel more like a traditional tower defense game. In my experience with both of these characters, the undead knight is quite a bit more powerful than the puppet master. This is because the knight is able to make weak units strong for relatively low mana costs. The puppet master’s puppets are strong, especially due to the fact that they can be summoned anywhere around an allied building, but the towers she summons are much too expensive for the their hitpoint pool and relative damage. Especially the Teddy Bear card that takes eighty mana for a unit that is not much stronger than a soldier skeleton.  The overworld is quite similar to the one found in other RPG card battlers in that there are branching paths that can be planned and have differing purposes. The most common are battles, but stores dot the map as do resting spots that provide health, card upgrades, or card removal. Shops require gold and allow for one card to be removed for a cost. Units are summoned using mana that is accumulated over time. Units are mainly undead or demons in appearance and they have health, attack, armor, and movement speed stats. The main issue that I have with the units is that there are only eight kinds of units and they are all pretty similar except for an ability. These abilities aren’t very unique either as other units can often gain these abilities with an upgrade. There are some unique upgrades that I would love to see more of and did make units unique, though they are pretty rare. The best upgrades were for the healer unit. The player could get an attack speed aura, increase the healing aura it emitted, or a rare upgrade was to spawn three weak, albeit, free units every fifteen seconds.  Enemy units have the same issue that player units have in that there is very little variety. Enemy units usually come in five or six varieties and have additional abilities applied to them based upon how hard the battle is, such as an elite battle. Enemies also don’t seem to cost the AI any mana, unlike the player. This makes it so that the AI’s strategy late game is to simply spam an ungoldy amount of units that are quite difficult to beat. The main way to defeat the AI in the early game is by focusing on cheap units with armor breaker. These will rip through the strong enemy units that it spawns as a challenge. The late game strategy is to get lots of units with Area of Effect attacks. The main issue I had with this is that the units with Area of Effect attacks are quite expensive in terms of mana which makes it difficult to compete against the legions of enemy units that run at the player. An interesting concept this game employs is that both the player as well as the AI gets artifacts. The main issue I found is that there are a good amount of player artifacts that are useless, while the AI has a ton of really strong artifacts. Two of the useless artifacts I received were coupons that made cards at the shop cheaper which wasn’t an issue due to money being really easy to obtain. The second artifact would summon nine powerful units, but only if the player played six of each card type, which was not realistic at all. Some artifacts such as enchanted pillar which provides more mana are almost required for a good run. Enemy artifacts are powerful as they often punish the player’s deck with useless cards.  Battles are fought on a three-dimensional map that has a certain path that units follow. Later maps have additional paths that can be chosen between by the player by modifying the direction a sign is facing. Battle is rather zen, but gets annoying later on in a run. This is because there are small villages that provide extra control and start out under enemy control. Late game, if the player does not get these villages in about a minute and a half, they have lost.  Battle maps don’t have a lot of variety and are simply reskins. This feels lazy and unpolished. There is a minor story, but it isn’t interesting. The player has a summoning crystal fused to them and they have to find the great Necronator. The traveling companion to the player’s chosen commander is a cute bat character named Chubat.  The sound design isn’t especially good in Necronator. The music gets quite repetitive very quickly, so much so that I turned it off withing the first ten minutes I played the game. The sounds can also get cacophonous as many units attacking each other all making attacking sounds playing over each other does not sound enjoyable at high to moderate volume levels. The graphics are the best part of the game. The game is three-dimensional in nature, but the textures are styled after pixel art which creates a diorama feeling. This is further compounded by the fact that all of the units in the game are pixel art sprites.  The controls are quite frustrating to deal which is surprising considering keyboard and mouse is rather accurate. When trying to pan using the left mouse button, sometimes it doesn’t work when the player accidentally mouses over their hand full of cards. The game also feels too much like a mobile port. To move the camera without accessing the camera menu, the player must swipe left or right with the mouse while hold the right mouse button.  :  The game feels pretty buggy, especially with the pathfinding AI. This AI never seems to know where to go and gets stuck rather frequently. After about 5 hours I felt like I had already seen everything. Due to this, the twenty USD price tag is too high to justify the amount the amount of content in it.    👍   👍 Beautiful graphics 👎   👎 Low enemy variety Few units to use Repetitive gameplay", "appid": "1144970", "steamid": "profiles/76561198055780740", "voted_up": false, "votes_up": "38", "votes_funny": 0, "early_access": false, "tstamp_created": 1596456000.0}

{"text": "Came here to leave a bad review because I do not (and will not) own GTA 5. Take-Two Interactive cannot seem to get it right time and time again. {"text": "Well, it's a disappointment alright. When the first trailer of RE3 got uploaded only a few months after the release of RE2, I could tell that this will be a rushed work. But since Capcom has redeemed themselves over the years and especially with the RE2 Remake, I still had high hopes for this one. And although the game did not fail entirely, it however mostly failed to meet expectations.  My main issue with the game is of course what has been echoed throughout in almost every review, it's that it's laughably short.(It averages of 4-5 hours for most people the first time) People love to make the arguement that the original was already short so it's justified. This statement makes me cringe so hard. Just because it's a remake doesn't necessarily mean it has to be the same length as the original. Especially when the remake removes a lot of content from the original game: -Areas: Clock Tower, The Park and Dead Factory -The Grave Digger Boss -Actual good puzzles -Those moments where you could make a choice in certain situations and would make the game playout differently -Mercenaries mode All of these made the original much more replayable regardless of its length, which the remake lacks. It's true that RE2 remake also did cut out some things from the original, but since that game was so well designed and well paced it wasn't really a big deal, it's a great game even on its own right. I've played this game on standard difficulty, and since I was playing an RE game, I've naturally avoided combat as much as I could. But eventually I got to the end point and noticed I had way too much ammo and way too many healing items. At points the game gave you so much sh*t to store that it became comical. So basically don't play on standard difficulty, it's a cakewalk. Choosing the higher difficulty also doesn't include ink ribbons anymore(♥♥♥♥♥), so even in that difficulty the tension isn't that high. Now to the positives: -The game looks amazing, even better than RE2:RE -The beginning of the game where you are in the city is pretty good(after the city the game slowly goes downhill) -When the Nemesis chases you in the city(None of that scripted events BS) -The boss battles are kinda better than in RE2:RE, but still are meh -The dodge mechanic: I was really hoping they would include it here to make the game stand out more, and they gladly did. However it's not perfect. I hate to say it but QTE's such as these to dodge or counter enemies were done better in RE6, since in that game an icon always popped up at the moment when you could do these moves, hence you could practice it much better. In RE3 it only came in handy as a last resort. Still not bad though. So despite all of these flaws I still wouldn't say that this is a bad game, far from it. However this game is asking for full price(60 euros) which it clearly is not worth. \"But you get a seperate multiplayer game with it.\" Welp, bad news. It's kinda bad. I wouldn't have get it if it wasn't included with RE3. So nope, game's not worth 60 euros, so for the time being as long as it does not drop down to at least 30 euros tops, I'm gonna give this game a negative review.
